programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Gina comes under questioning when Linda finds out there is 200 missing from the Vic's takings. Anna decides to go through with her decision to find her mum and Freddie decides to look for his dad after seeing Alfie throw a party for Bert and Ernie. Stacey and Eve hatch a plan to find her stalker

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Photographer Brock Elbank takes images of Araf, Scotland's first Asian paramedic, who also works with local mosques and gurdwaras, equipping them with first-aid knowledge and providing a bridge between communities. Brock's photographic projects focus on idiosyncratic and unique features, such as scars, birthmarks and skin conditions such as vitiligo, to capture the private stories behind a public persona

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Thriller about a detective haunted by his brother's childhood disappearance, who becomes obsessed with the idea that his neighbour may have been responsible. Elsewhere, a family return to their rural Welsh home from London to be confronted with disturbing discoveries that have echoes of an infamous double murder committed in the area - and the possibility that someone intends to re-enact the killings

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: It looks like the end of the road for Freddy and Baba, trapped in a remote cottage by Lola, Jackson and a squad of armed response officers. With the trail behind them strewn with bodies, it seems unlikely they will escape the reckoning. Psychological thriller, starring Eve Myles and Babou Ceesay

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts an extended episode, with comedian Ivo Graham and journalist Isabel Hardman joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An anonymous tip leads police to crack the UK's biggest case of food fraud. An officer's instinct uncovers a conspiracy to commit massive insurance fraud and a faulty break light leads to police arresting two high level drug dealers

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle follow a male lion being introduced to eight females in the hope of starting a whole new pride in the park. Plus, how elephants keep maintain the strength of their trunks in captivity and an attempt to mate two emus

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a two-bedrooom bungalow in Lowestoft, Suffolk before catching up with two brothers renovating a Victorian building in Gorleston-on-Sea, Norfolk. Tommy Walsh is in Verney Junction, Buckinghamshire to hear about the development plans for a three-bedroom mid-terraced cottage

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Caroline Hawley and Phillip Serrell are on hand as two teams test their antiques knowledge at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire. The competing duos then head to auction in Derbyshire. Presenter Charlie Ross oversees proceedings and also finds out about a classic car collection

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Roseland Peninsula, beginning at a spot believed by some to have been visited by Jesus Christ. He tours the bay of St Mawes with Alex and Olga Polizzi, who own one of Cornwall's most luxurious hotels, and meets one of the county's oldest butchers, who demonstrates the ancient practice of aging meat. Finally, in the harbourside village of Mousehole, Rick meets a potter who finds inspiration from the local landscape

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson and podcaster Rosie Ramsey visit a forest camp in Northumberland set up to help Army veterans, where they sign up for a bushcraft lesson, attempt to build a shelter and make a fire. They also enjoy a buggy race, before Robson meets the horses whose company can help in the treatment of anxiety

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple to find a home in the Norfolk countryside for 700,000, and gets a glimpse of the latest Lotus hypercar, which is manufactured in the area

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: After worrying her autism would stop her developing her skills, Belinda has become a talented glassblower with the potential to turn her art into a money-making business. Paul and Becky have a passion for upcycling furniture and are hoping to turn their hobby into a day job. Dom Chinea and his team of experts meets all three makers and helps them to make their aspirations a reality

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Roo Irvine and Mark Hill take a tour of the Highlands. A rare piece of glass and a penny bank go under the gavel, and one of Scotland's strongest men helps the pair on their way

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Freddie demands the truth about his dad's identity but Kat won't tell. Stacey is on high alert around the men of Walford and tension rises between the Knight sisters as Anna secretly meets with a private investigator

programme.title: What They Really Mean For You
programme.desc: Justin Rowlatt, Michelle Ackerley and Dr Tara Shine investigate the eco-friendly alternatives to oil and gas boilers and if it's possible to build an entirely low-carbon electricity network before the government's net zero target of 2050. Justin explores a futuristic house in Salford that is used to test new heating technologies in extreme conditions. Michelle gets an insight into how heat pumps are installed and the cost of doing so. Tara meets the gas company promoting hydrogen as the solution to home heating and finds out if it is a feasible option

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: A vet finds something trapped in the intestines of Bear the lost dog. Jack delves deeper into the Donkey Pitch case and becomes convinced there was a second killer

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Gaia: A Death on Dancing Ledge
programme.desc: Zara McDermott investigates a mysterious death from 2017, in which a 19-year-old from Dorset ran away from home in a state of distress. Her body would later be found in the undergrowth by a massive search operation, having died of hypothermia. The first episode examines the early clues that were discovered and the suspicion that fell on a childhood friend and his grandmother, before they were released without charge

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Manville researches her family tree. So far as her mother's side is concerned, by delving deep into Brighton's local archives, Lesley uncovers a complex story of wartime separation, adultery and the inaccessibility of divorce. Tracing back her father's line sees Lesley trying to solve what happened to her ancestor Aaron Harding. A widower with a large family to feed, Aaron protested poor conditions and pay as an agricultural worker in 1830 - a protest that would become known as the Swing Riots. He was arrested and subsequently transported to Australia

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An unusual licence plate helps police crack an international smuggling operation and a call about a disturbance leads officers to discover a huge haul of firearms. A group of youths smoking cannabis leads to the solving of a string of robberies

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in Koala Creek as kidney disease claims the life of Wilpena, but there is also happier news on the marsupial front when Ben and Kate catch up with wallaby Newt

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a grand five-bedroom Victorian terrace in Brighton. Plus, the progress of houses in Beeston in Nottinghamshire and Welwyn Garden City in Hertfordshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts David Harper and Raj Bisram guide the red and the blue teams around Ardingly Antiques Fair, West Sussex, before the teams take their items to auction. Natasha also visits an elaborate well, a gift from a Maharajah, opened in 1864

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Tintagel, Cornwall's most mythical place, which was an important trading port with Europe and the birthplace of perhaps Britain's greatest legend - the tale of King Arthur. He also learns how the Methodists were important to Cornwall, and how they would cook a rather unusual bun during feast days, and meets a family on the Roseland Peninsula who are continuing the surprisingly ancient tradition of growing an exotic spice - saffron

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Former Emmerdale actress Charlie Hardwick shows Robson the hidden gems of the East Durham coastline. The pair take an art class on the sand, a wellness choir teacher shows how singing outdoors can be good for mind and body, and Robson signs up for a session with a forest bathing instructor among the trees of Hamsterley Forest

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple who want to find a property in the Welsh Borders, preferably with holiday let potential or space for a glamping, on a budget of 1million

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Labourer Mike has a passion for turning wooden bowls but feels held back by his perfectionist attitude to his creations. During the pandemic Sarah quit her job and took up pottery but has been struggling to make enough money from it to live on. With the help and advice of Dom Chinea and his team of experts, Mike and Sarah try their best to create smooth running businesses out of their crafts and turn their hobbies into a day job

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Roo Irvine and Mark Hill continue their Scottish jaunt as a 1970s Triumph transports the duo to shops scattered throughout the Highlands. A Georgian silver brooch gives veteran Tripper Roo something solemn to think about, but a rather unorthodox key rack, she hopes, will unlock some big profits. Meanwhile, rookie Tripper Mark continues to buy like an old hand as he finds a wooden sculpture of a naked torso that makes for an exhilarating auction

programme.title: Pointless

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Freddie meets his dad and Kat finally tells him the truth. Elaine hatches a plan to get the Knight sisters to steal customers from the Albert but Gina is rattled when Anna brings up their mum again

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts revive a theatre chair from Derby Hippodrome, restore a unique and whimsical timepiece, and resurrect a cherished bronze locket

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk visit Carol and her sons Keith and Thomas in Northamptonshire to help declutter after the death of husband and father John, an avid antiques collector. They set up their pop-up auction at the Avoncroft Museum of Historic Buildings in hope of finding the right bidders for John's collection. Carol plans to use any profits to renovate a memorial spot in her garden

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Reality star Dani Dyer, actor James Buckley, comedian Marcus Brigstocke, former Gogglebox star Mica Ven and TV and radio presenter Richie Anderson compete in the first heat of the celebrity contest. The first challenge sees the contestants each given a different ingredient to showcase in a single dish. Then they have to make a main course and a dessert for a dinner party, knowing that John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be sending one of them home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena and Amy meet a white industry executive famed for successful films and TV shows with black talent. Kwabena persuades him to read his script, only to suspect that his ideas have been stolen. Kwabena also meets Vanessa's wealthy friends, Amy continues to struggle with microaggressions at work, and Maurice decides to go vegan. Guest starring Jessica Hynes and Isy Suttie

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Funmi goes into labour, but when the doctors refuse to listen to her concerns, she ends up forced into an emergency c-section that leaves her life hanging in the balance. A baby on the way means Kwabena desperately needs somewhere new to live, but given his financial situation, and the housing crisis in London, it's proving difficult. Stephanie is worried about her son, a cheeky, aspiring rapper who has fallen in with the wrong crowd

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League striker Kevin Campbell, European champion sprinter Adam Gemili, Ashes-winning cricketer Ashley Giles and world 800m and 4x400m bronze medallist Jenny Meadows join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don harvests his potatoes and sows seeds for autumn vegetables. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings. Adam Frost meets a couple who have spent decades creating a garden on the exposed chalk hills of the Yorkshire Wolds and Sue Kent refreshes her garden to extend the colour and interest into late summer and autumn. Gardeners working in an extraordinary location on the edge of cliffs in Penzance reveal the wind-swept challenges they face and viewers meet a Sussex gardener who has taken the idea of outdoor living to a whole new level

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Scott Smith checks out the roses in the Picket Fence Garden, offering tips on feeding, dealing with diseases, and propagation, and explaining the differences in varieties. George Anderson is on the allotment in Joppa, updating viewers on the sweet potatoes he planted last month as well as checking out his pumpkin and sweetcorn

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader submerges himself in the famous hot springs of Saturnia. He also joins Italy's last surviving cowboys, known as the Butteri, to learn how to lasso and barbecue the perfect steak

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the latest leg on the seafront at Felixstowe, where in January 1953 the town was engulfed in the worst flooding to hit England in the 20th century. In Norwich, he admires the Norman Cathedral, then traces the history of the postcode

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Canada v Australia (Kick-off 11.00am). All the action from both teams' third and final match in Group B, held at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium in Australia. The co-hosts know that a victory will see them qualify for the knockout stage, while a draw would mean they require a victory for Republic of Ireland over Nigeria in order for them to progress, and a loss would result in elimination. Gabby Logan presents, with analysis by Steph Houghton and Rachel Brown-Finnis, and commentary by Robyn Cowen and Anita Asante

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Kenneth Williams, UK hit singles 2000-2004, Ada Lovelace, and the Rugby World Cup, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two returnees and a newcomer make their way to the kitchen for the Scotland heats, preparing their starters and fish courses. Gordon Jones presents a risky starter which combines raw mackerel and porridge, inspired by childhood memories spent fishing, while Lorna McNee offers a new twist on the classic snack, cheese on toast. For his fish course, Ben Reade decides to showcase halibut as a tribute to his favourite DJ, John Peel

programme.title: World's Sneakiest Animals
programme.desc: Naturalist Chris Packham observes the devious tactics and sneaky tricks that some animals carry out in order to survive. New, ground-breaking science helps reveal astonishing visual trickery, from illusionist zebras to vanishing geckos and shape-shifting cuttlefish. Mischievous mimics, from snakes to baby birds disguised as caterpillars, and a lioness who looks like a male lion are also highlighted. The world's ultimate con artists can even rely on sneaky strategies against their own kind, such as the monkey that cheats its family and the lizard that fakes its death

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Pig farmers Morgan and Tasha take their Duroc pigs to compete for their first time in the Royal Welsh Show, while seasoned competitor Amanda is desperate to win a rosette to seal her reputation as a pedigree breeder. Show day brings the hottest temperature ever recorded in Wales and the farmers have to get creative to keep the pigs cool and comfortable

programme.title: Netball World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents coverage of a match from the second group stage (Centre-pass 5.00pm), held at Cape Town International Convention Centre in South Africa. England, Scotland and Wales had all qualified for this tournament, with England expected to reach this stage after finishing third in 2019. With analysis from Ama Agbeze

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Isa Guha presents action from day five of the Fifth Test, as the Ashes series concluded at Kia Oval in London. While England's overall Test match record has been inconsistent here in recent years, they have had the better of things against the Aussies, winning five of the last 10 contests dating back to 1985, while Australia have only won twice

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as devotees of choral music the Antiphons take on red wine connoisseurs Drop of Red. The teams must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Beautiful Horizon, Joyful Port, Saint Paul, and River of January

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the third of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from Birkbeck, University of London pit their wits against a team from Oxford Brookes University in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Amol Rajan asks the questions

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham tells the story of how plant life turned Earth from a barren rock into a vibrant green world - a 4.5 billion-year saga of extraordinary highs and lows that almost wiped out all life. He reveals how a giant asteroid bombardment triggered Earth's plate tectonics, leading to huge fungi, soil and giant swamp forests, but the early plants locked in so much carbon dioxide that global temperatures suddenly plunged

programme.title: Naked Video
programme.desc: Comedy sketch show featuring characters including Siadwel, the Bald Man, Helen in the Wine Bar and Rab C Nesbitt. Starring Gregor Fisher, Elaine C Smith, Andy Gray, Tony Roper, Helen Lederer, Jonathan Watson and John Sparkes. First shown in 1989

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: On the Basis of Sex (2018)
programme.desc: Biopic of lawyer Ruth Bader Ginsburg showing how she faced adversity and numerous obstacles in her fight for equal rights throughout her career, which culminated in her becoming a member of the Supreme Court of the United States. Starring Felicity Jones, with Armie Hammer, Justin Theroux and Kathy Bates

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the aftermath of one of the biggest fires to ever engulf the UK countryside, Joe Crowley and John Craven explore the impact of increasing wildfires. Joe is in the Scottish Highlands to meet people who have been tackling a wildfire that has been burning since May, while John is in Surrey to reveal how nature reserves can be adapted to stop fire in its tracks. Plus, Adam Henson looks at fire safety on a farm

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore explores Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, determined to save quality items from being crushed. There's a sliding door sideboard for furniture painter Chloe Kempster and a collection of wooden skis for lighting designer Duncan McKean. Sarah herself gets crafty with a collection of knitted blankets and patches. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The story of keen sailor Natasha Lambert, who has cerebral palsy. Natasha cannot use her arms or legs, so her father invented a system that would enable her to control a boat by breathing in and out of a straw. First, she sailed the Solent and then traversed the English Channel. Each time her challenges got bigger and bigger. Now, Natasha wants to control a 46-ft yacht across the Atlantic. This documentary charts a family determined to enable Natasha to fulfil her dream, illustrating how her ambition has inspired all of them

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham tells the story of the event 800 million years ago when almost the entire planet froze and the chances of life surviving hung in the balance. Earth's journey into the deep freeze started with fire when the giant supercontinent Rodinia broke up and vast powerful tectonic forces ripped the land apart, kicking off a series of events that resulted in huge amounts of carbon dioxide being sucked from the atmosphere - sending global temperatures plummeting

programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges an impressionist painter, a metal sculptor and an artist who paints in a caravan to create artwork for a London couple who have just renovated their home

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Trent Rockets v Southern Brave (Start-time 3.00pm). Isa Guha presents live coverage of the opening women's match of the season, held at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. These sides met in the Eliminator last season, with Brave winning by two runs to reach the final, but losing out to Oval Invincibles in the showpiece match for the second successive year

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Trent Rockets v Southern Brave (Start-time 6.30pm). Isa Guha presents live coverage of the first men's match of the campaign, held at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. The Rockets are the reigning champions, having defeated Manchester Originals in last year's final, while Brave are looking to improve this time around after finishing seventh of eight teams in 2022

programme.title: Inside Dubai: Playground of the Rich
programme.desc: As the tax haven celebrates its 50th birthday and looks to the future, the programme asks whether it can keep it up the frenetic pace, revealing plans to more than double the number of tourists over the next 20 years. Cameras also follow Liverpudlian nightclub entrepreneur Chris Wright as he opens a new bar in a developing complex of beach clubs, benefitting from a relaxation in the rules around alcohol

programme.title: Molly's Game (2017)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game for a decade before being arrested in the middle of the night by FBI agents wielding automatic weapons. Her players included Hollywood royalty, sports stars, business titans and finally - unbeknownst to her - the Russian Mob. Directed by The West Wing creator Aaron Sorkin, and starring Jessica Chastain, Idris Elba and Kevin Costner

The programme also follows deaf mountaineer Morag Skelton as she climbs Scimitar Ridge in Glen Nevis, and Tyron Wolfe, who spent eight months journeying around South America, shares tips on travelling alone

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey in the East Yorkshire resort of Hornsea, famous for its distinctive pottery. In Hull, he discovers how one of Hull FC's star players made history as Britain's first black rugby captain. From Hull, Michael hitches a ride on a fine-looking barge heading to Goole on a network of canals. At Spurn Point, Michael hears how along this coast an ingenious 19th-century RNLI invention saved many lives

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Argentina v Sweden (Kick-off 8.00am). All the action from the third and final group match for both teams, held at Waikato Stadium in Hamilton, New Zealand. Argentina have never previously progressed beyond this stage, while 2019 was the fourth time Sweden had reached at least the semi-finals and they eventually finished third. Alex Scott presents, with analysis from Fern Whelan and Jonas Eidevall, and commentary by Jonathan Pearce and Sue Smith

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Denis and Eric from Herefordshire have spent almost 40 years rearing cattle and tending their orchards. As experienced sellers at the Ludlow Food Festival they know that preparing plenty of samples and flavours of their award-winning ciders is likely to bring them the business their hoping for. Livestock farmers Joanne and Nigel from Powys have got all hands on deck to prepare their hot food stand for the festival

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Documentary examining the life of the actress, beginning as aspiring star Norma Jeane Baker attends an audition at 20th Century Fox, where the head of casting suggests she change her name to Marilyn Monroe. After connecting with Joseph Schenck, Marilyn is able to get a job at Columbia Pictures, where she receives her first starring role. Narrated by Jessica Chastain

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Marilyn's rise is nearly ruined when news breaks that she posed nude for a calendar earlier in her career. She uses this to her advantage to showcase her body confidence. Monroe also demonstrates her unique talent for comedy in Gentlemen Prefer Blondes, and reaches superstar status

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Nick Ansell heads to the National Space Centre where astronomy enthusiast Derek Rowley talks about a project that's making the subject of space more accessible to deaf people. The programme also follows deaf mountaineer Morag Skelton as she climbs Scimitar Ridge in Glen Nevis, and Tyron Wolfe, who spent eight months journeying around South America, shares tips on travelling alone

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Caitriona and Kevin thought they had hit the property jackpot after moving from a tiny flat to a three-bedroom house in Rickmansworth, Herefordshire. But as they have discovered, there is no comfortable family space downstairs, the kitchen is cramped and their growing twins squabble over who has to sleep in the tiny box room every night. Enter architects Damion Burrows and Lynsey Elliott, who come up with alternative VR solutions to the couple's property problems - only one of which they can make a reality. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Riya and Nanda have a sad and unloved garden in Groby, Leicestershire, with an outdated pink and yellow 'Battenburg' patio, a tumble down shed and a huge gravel slope. This really is a plot that needs to be rescued, especially as Riya is soon to be married and they are hoping to host some of the celebrations in the garden. Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam offer expert advice, which involves picking up on the reds and golds of Riya's wedding colours in the planting

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's Scottish railway journey reaches Aberdeen. From the granite city, Michael heads out to Forvie National Nature Reserve, which is 1,000 hectares of protected coastal habitat dominated by grassy dunes

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Ben Garrod explores how animals' skin acts as a barrier between them and the outside world, shielding them from extremes of temperature, harmful effects of UV and organisms

programme.title: Treasures of the Indus
programme.desc: Sona Datta examines the artistic legacy of the Mughal Empire, from the Taj Mahal to fabulously intricate miniatures of court life, and traces how it also sowed the seeds of discord

programme.title: Death Camp Treblinka: Survivor Stories
programme.desc: An insight into how Samuel Willenberg and Kalman Taigman escaped from the concentration camp in Poland, where more than 800,000 Polish Jews died during the Nazi Holocaust. The two men were able to flee during a revolt in August 1943, before one of them sought vengeance in the 1944 Warsaw Uprising and the other appeared at the trial of Adolf Eichmann for war crimes in 1961. This film documents their stories, the fate of their families and offers fresh accounts of a forgotten death camp

programme.title: Shadow of Truth
programme.desc: Documentary investigation into the murder of a 13-year-old Israeli schoolgirl in 2006. Tair Rada is found dead inside a locked toilet cubicle at her school. The police are under heavy pressure to find her killer and a suspect is arrested

programme.title: Shadow of Truth
programme.desc: Suspect Roman Zadorov retracts his confession, claiming he was coerced into it by the detectives. A month after his arrest, the trial for Tair Rada's murder begins

programme.title: Catching History's Criminals: The Forensics Story
programme.desc: An insight into the development of forensic science as a way of catching murderers over the past 200 years, charting the scientific breakthroughs that have changed the course of justice. Surgeon and writer Gabriel Weston begins by looking at the difficulty of identifying the body in a murder case, from charred bones to bodies completely dissolved in acid. She focuses on the use of teeth and bite marks to identify a victim or killer, traces the uses of insects to pinpoint the time of death, and meets the geneticist who pioneered the technique of DNA profiling

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski considers the new skills that were required when nomads began settling in townships, leading to the development of science, in the form of architecture. Bronowski looks at examples including the Inca cities in the high Andes, the Roman aqueducts in Spain and the great cathedrals of medieval France as he looks at how mankind uncovered the laws of nature in the stone. First shown in 1973

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Dr Jacob Bronowski traces the evolution of chemistry, from the techniques of ancient metallurgy in China and Japan to the mystical searchings of the alchemists and Dalton's atomic theory. First shown in 1973

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's Scottish railway journey reaches Aberdeen. From the granite city, Michael heads out to Forvie National Nature Reserve, which is 1,000 hectares of protected coastal habitat dominated by grassy dunes

programme.title: Treasures of the Indus
programme.desc: Sona Datta examines the artistic legacy of the Mughal Empire, from the Taj Mahal to fabulously intricate miniatures of court life, and traces how it also sowed the seeds of discord

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses the Culloden Viaduct aboard the Caledonian Sleeper to arrive bright and early in Inverness, from where he heads north on a magnificent scenic adventure to the Orkney archipelago. On boggy moorland overlooking the Moray Firth near Inverness, Michael explores the battlefield at Culloden, where Bonnie Prince Charlie's Jacobite army fought British Government troops in 1746

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Biologist Ben Garrod examines how animals use their skin to send out messages to their own species, and warning signals to others

programme.title: Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice Remember - Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: It's 50 years since accident-prone Frank Spencer and his long-suffering wife Betty first appeared on the small screen. Here, Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice - the actors who brought them to life - are reunited to recall their time working on the hit 1970s sitcom. They reveal how they came to be cast, what it was like to film the series and the impact the show's success had on their lives and careers

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: In a bid to find work, disaster-prone Frank attends an interview for a job as an ironmonger's salesman. Another chance to see the first episode of the comedy series, starring Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice

programme.title: To Be Perfectly Frank
programme.desc: Michael Crawford reveals how he created Frank Spencer in this documentary going behind the scenes of Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em, which also features detailed preparations for some of the hilarious but extremely dangerous stunts from the series. First shown in 1977

programme.title: Royal History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The presenter explores some of the myths swirling around the French Revolution of 1789 - an uprising that brought down the nation's royal family. This violent revolution became the blueprint of many future revolutions across the world, but what exactly happened during this turbulent period is open to manipulation and interpretation. Historian Michael Rapport explains how the revolution was not started by starving peasants as many assume but was in fact sparked by a group of lawyers and property owners

programme.title: The Arts Interviews
programme.desc: The BBC's Culture editor Katie Razzall talks to Christopher Nolan, one of the world's most renowned film directors and the man behind films such as Memento, Inception and Dunkirk, to mark the release of his new film Oppenheimer. They discuss the Hollywood strikes, AI and film and why British-born Nolan was drawn to the story of J Robert Oppenheimer, the enigmatic Manhattan Project scientist who had a leading role in developing the atomic bomb

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Film documenting the rise and fall of scientist J Robert Oppenheimer, the director of the project that developed the first atomic bomb. He later tried to prevent a nuclear arms race in his role with the Atomic Energy Commision, but his stance made him many political enemies and he was later put on trial for supposed communist sympathies. The events are told through dramatic re-creation and expert testimony, with David Strathairn taking the role of Oppenheimer. Zoe Wanamaker narrates

programme.title: Death Camp Treblinka: Survivor Stories
programme.desc: An insight into how Samuel Willenberg and Kalman Taigman escaped from the concentration camp in Poland, where more than 800,000 Polish Jews died during the Nazi Holocaust. The two men were able to flee during a revolt in August 1943, before one of them sought vengeance in the 1944 Warsaw Uprising and the other appeared at the trial of Adolf Eichmann for war crimes in 1961. This film documents their stories, the fate of their families and offers fresh accounts of a forgotten death camp

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses the Culloden Viaduct aboard the Caledonian Sleeper to arrive bright and early in Inverness, from where he heads north on a magnificent scenic adventure to the Orkney archipelago. On boggy moorland overlooking the Moray Firth near Inverness, Michael explores the battlefield at Culloden, where Bonnie Prince Charlie's Jacobite army fought British Government troops in 1746

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: A glimpse at the rarely seen South American wilderness, home to a range of creatures from terrain as varied as the Andes to Cape Horn. Cameras reveal the secret lives of pumas and hummingbirds, soar with condors over glacial peaks and explore monkey puzzle forests dating back to the time of the dinosaurs. The extreme kayakers who gain thrills and excitement from traversing the area's raging waterfalls are observed, as are the native cowboys, known as gauchos, as they round up wild horses. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera

programme.title: Royal History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The presenter explores some of the myths swirling around the French Revolution of 1789 - an uprising that brought down the nation's royal family. This violent revolution became the blueprint of many future revolutions across the world, but what exactly happened during this turbulent period is open to manipulation and interpretation. Historian Michael Rapport explains how the revolution was not started by starving peasants as many assume but was in fact sparked by a group of lawyers and property owners

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by train north from Inverness to the Orkney Islands. Beginning on the Moray Firth, Michael admires the Cullen Viaduct then enjoys a bowl of Cullen skink at a family-run fishmonger of 150 years' standing. In the factory smokery, he learns from the owner how the famous soup acquires its distinctive taste

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Biologist Ben Garrod explores the armour and weaponry vertebrate skin has adapted to deploy, from quills to deadly toxins and camouflage

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: The documentary offering a glimpse into the rarely seen South American wilderness continues, this time following the path of the relentless wind sweeping east through Patagonia's dry desert from the Andes' peaks. The programme reveals a weird world of maras - a large relative of the guinea pig - and penguins, and witnesses the first faltering steps of baby guanacos - Patagonia's very own camels. Cameras also observe the people who have taken on this inhospitable environment and carved out a home for themselves. Santiago Cabrera narrates

programme.title: Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: The historian reveals hows Egypt's enemies exploited a country weakened by internal strife, travelling south to Sudan to examine the story of the forgotten Nubian kings, who ruled Egypt from their southern homeland for a century, even building their own pyramids to bury their monarchs. She then explores how the next group of invaders the Saites took the tradition of mummification to new extremes by preserving millions of animals, before Alexander the Great came to Egypt's rescue and founded the greatest city on Earth

programme.title: Martin Amis, Money and Memories with William Boyd
programme.desc: Novelist William Boyd looks back on his long friendship with fellow writer Martin Amis, who died in May this year at the age of 73. He focuses on what many consider to be Amis's most successful work, 1984's Money, which introduced readers to the hedonistic would-be film-maker John Self, and was adapted by the BBC in 2010

programme.title: Money
programme.desc: British commercial-maker John Self travels to America to direct a feature film, with backing from financial high-flyer Fielding Goodney. As he hurls himself into a life of near-total excess, the project becomes plagued by conflicts among the cast - and John becomes the target of a menacing stalker. First in a two-part adaptation of Martin Amis's darkly comic novel, starring Nick Frost, Vincent Kartheiser and Jerry Hall. First shown in 2010

programme.title: Money
programme.desc: Conclusion. John is angry when the script finally arrives and he discovers his original vision has disappeared, so he decides to rewrite it himself. His new version is a success, gaining the praise of Fielding and the cast, but the mysterious caller keeps drawing nearer, and the appearance of a red-headed woman who resembles his mother complicates matters. Adaptation of Martin Amis's novel, starring Nick Frost and Vincent Kartheiser. First shown in 2010

programme.title: Mark Lawson Talks To
programme.desc: The cultural commentator interviews the author, whose works include Money and London Fields. Amis discusses his relationship with his father Kingsley, and reveals how his sister Sally's struggles in life influenced his novel The Pregnant Widow

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys

She starts by adding garlic puree, Korean chilli paste, soy sauce, honey, toasted sesame oil and her special ingredient, sesame seeds, into a jug and mixing them all up. Next, Hannah puts pieces of her salmon onto individual baking sheets and spoons the marinade on. She garnishes them with freshly chopped spring onions, and then her salmon is ready to be cooked in the oven. Hannah wears a colourful Korean outfit and treats her friends to some local Korean kimchi, but will her pals be able to guess her special ingredient?

The boys are surprised to find an old sheet with a funny picture of a skeleton on it. What could it mean? And who does it belong to? Its off to the Museum of Cornish Treasures to see if Suzy and Archie have any clues. They reckon its something to do with ships and send Fred and Pete off to Charlestown Harbour. programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Febo's family are from America, where they celebrate Thanksgiving. As it is traditional on Thanksgiving to prepare and serve pumpkin pie as a dessert, Febo is making this for his friends. He starts by making a pastry case and fitting it into a pie dish. For the pumpkin filling: he pours melted butter and buttermilk into a bowl of brown sugar, along with whisked egg, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, allspice and cloves. Febo adds his special ingredient, pumpkin puree, and then mixes them all together. When it's mixed, he spoons it into the empty pastry case and puts it in the oven to cook. Febo's friends all help to decorate his American-themed table before they taste his pumpkin pie.

At the Lizard Peninsula, Rick heads out to sea to fish for red mullet, and on the wild coast at Land's End, he discovers why Cornwall has a rather unusual animal as its national emblem

programme.desc: The actor joins forces with his brother David and his uncle Matheson to try out landscape painting in the fresh air on the hunt for ways to relax that do not cost a fortune. A trip to an organised tree-top adventure park follows before they return to the family favourite of fly-fishing on a picturesque Northumbrian lake

programme.title: Escape to the Country

In the first episode, Morgan's furniture is beautifully crafted, but he lacks the confidence to really sell it. Cath's life-sized fantastical willow woven creatures are unique - but are they saleable?

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: BBC Wales Investigates
programme.desc: Wyre Davies investigates the case of 96-year-old Lily, who has been stuck in a hospital bed for 11 months. She just wants to go home, but her council cannot find carers to look after her. The programme discovers just how many other people there are like Lily, and reveals the wider impact that a shortage of carers is having - including on the NHS

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Photographer Brock Elbank takes images of Araf, Scotland's first Asian paramedic, who also works with local mosques and gurdwaras, equipping them with first-aid knowledge and providing a bridge between communities. Brock's photographic projects focus on idiosyncratic and unique features, such as scars, birthmarks and skin conditions such as vitiligo, to capture the private stories behind a public persona

programme.title: Wolf

Elsewhere, a family return to their rural Welsh home from London to be confronted with disturbing discoveries that have echoes of an infamous double murder committed in the area - and the possibility that someone intends to re-enact the killings

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Roseland Peninsula, beginning at a spot believed by some to have been visited by Jesus Christ. He tours the bay of St Mawes with Alex and Olga Polizzi, who own one of Cornwall's most luxurious hotels, and meets one of the county's oldest butchers, who demonstrates the ancient practice of aging meat. Finally, in the harbourside village of Mousehole, Rick meets a potter who finds inspiration from the local landscape

programme.title: What They Really Mean For You
programme.desc: Justin Rowlatt, Michelle Ackerley and Dr Tara Shine investigate the eco-friendly alternatives to oil and gas boilers and if it's possible to build an entirely low-carbon electricity network before the government's net zero target of 2050. Justin explores a futuristic house in Salford that is used to test new heating technologies in extreme conditions. Michelle gets an insight into how heat pumps are installed and the cost of doing so. programme.title: Ruck Stars
programme.desc: After the Ospreys' impressive win against RGC, the team are in high spirits and Cori receives special recognition from the coaches for his performance. James ramps up his fitness training after missing out on the squad for the two previous matches, and Isaac cannot wait to get off the bench to make an impact on the pitch

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Tom Allen, former Blue Peter presenter Sarah Greene, rugby star Ugo Monye and comedian Morgana Robinson join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Manville researches her family tree. So far as her mother's side is concerned, by delving deep into Brighton's local archives, Lesley uncovers a complex story of wartime separation, adultery and the inaccessibility of divorce. Tracing back her father's line sees Lesley trying to solve what happened to her ancestor Aaron Harding. A widower with a large family to feed, Aaron protested poor conditions and pay as an agricultural worker in 1830 - a protest that would become known as the Swing Riots. He was arrested and subsequently transported to Australia

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in Koala Creek as kidney disease claims the life of Wilpena, but there is also happier news on the marsupial front when Ben and Kate catch up with wallaby Newt

programme.title: Walescast
programme.desc: BBC Wales politics editor Felicity Evans and political correspondent James Williams present interviews with MPs and analysis from experts about what is happening in the world of Welsh politics

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena and Amy meet a white industry executive famed for successful films and TV shows with black talent. programme.desc: Funmi goes into labour, but when the doctors refuse to listen to her concerns, she ends up forced into an emergency c-section that leaves her life hanging in the balance. programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses by joining presenter Dom Chinea at a life-changing training camp in the grounds of a arts-and-crafts house in Leicestershire. In the first episode, Morgan's furniture is beautifully crafted, but he lacks the confidence to really sell it. Cath's life-sized fantastical willow woven creatures are unique - but are they saleable?

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Photographer Brock Elbank takes images of Araf, Scotland's first Asian paramedic, who also works with local mosques and gurdwaras, equipping them with first-aid knowledge and providing a bridge between communities. Brock's photographic projects focus on idiosyncratic and unique features, such as scars, birthmarks and skin conditions such as vitiligo, to capture the private stories behind a public persona

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Thriller about a detective haunted by his brother's childhood disappearance, who becomes obsessed with the idea that his neighbour may have been responsible. Elsewhere, a family return to their rural Welsh home from London to be confronted with disturbing discoveries that have echoes of an infamous double murder committed in the area - and the possibility that someone intends to re-enact the killings

programme.desc: It looks like the end of the road for Freddy and Baba, trapped in a remote cottage by Lola, Jackson and a squad of armed response officers. programme.desc: Gina comes under questioning when Linda finds out there is 200 missing from the Vic's takings. Anna decides to go through with her decision to find her mum and Freddie decides to look for his dad after seeing Alfie throw a party for Bert and Ernie. Stacey and Eve hatch a plan to find her stalker

programme.title: A Stitch Through Time
programme.desc: It's elimination week as presenter Claire McCollum welcomes the four designers back to the design studio to face two cotton-based fashion challenges. First, the designers have 90 minutes to turn a selection of pre-loved cotton casuals into a standout skirt fit for the catwalk. Finally, the designers must create a power suit inspired by the Ulster-Scots entrepreneurs who introduced industrial cotton spinning to Belfast in the late 1700s

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Thriller about a detective haunted by his brother's childhood disappearance, who becomes obsessed with the idea that his neighbour may have been responsible. Elsewhere, a family return to their rural Welsh home from London to be confronted with disturbing discoveries that have echoes of an infamous double murder committed in the area - and the possibility that someone intends to re-enact the killings

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: Documentary following Patricia Page, aka Rat Woman, who is on a mission to rid the homes, businesses and streets of Northern Ireland of the ratty rodents, cocky cockroaches and whacky wasps. For many this a man's job, but Patricia - one of the only female pest controllers in the country - is unfazed by this work . She has her sights firmly set on becoming a legend in her own right as she battles the most common form of pests terrorising the country

programme.title: Community Life Appeal
programme.desc: Vinny Hurrell presents an appeal on behalf of Northern Ireland Blind Golf, which promotes health and wellness and inclusion for the visually impaired and blind. At Donaghadee in County Down, he is shown some of the skills of being a golf guide. Members of Northern Ireland Blind Golf will explain how seeing golfers have been helping those with visual impairment and blindness to participate in the sport. He'll hear how some local people have had great success in the sport internationally

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: It looks like the end of the road for Freddy and Baba, trapped in a remote cottage by Lola, Jackson and a squad of armed response officers. With the trail behind them strewn with bodies, it seems unlikely they will escape the reckoning. Psychological thriller, starring Eve Myles and Babou Ceesay

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts an extended episode, with comedian Ivo Graham and journalist Isabel Hardman joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An anonymous tip leads police to crack the UK's biggest case of food fraud. An officer's instinct uncovers a conspiracy to commit massive insurance fraud and a faulty break light leads to police arresting two high level drug dealers

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle follow a male lion being introduced to eight females in the hope of starting a whole new pride in the park. Plus, how elephants keep maintain the strength of their trunks in captivity and an attempt to mate two emus

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a two-bedrooom bungalow in Lowestoft, Suffolk before catching up with two brothers renovating a Victorian building in Gorleston-on-Sea, Norfolk. Tommy Walsh is in Verney Junction, Buckinghamshire to hear about the development plans for a three-bedroom mid-terraced cottage

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Caroline Hawley and Phillip Serrell are on hand as two teams test their antiques knowledge at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire. The competing duos then head to auction in Derbyshire. Presenter Charlie Ross oversees proceedings and also finds out about a classic car collection

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Roseland Peninsula, beginning at a spot believed by some to have been visited by Jesus Christ. He tours the bay of St Mawes with Alex and Olga Polizzi, who own one of Cornwall's most luxurious hotels, and meets one of the county's oldest butchers, who demonstrates the ancient practice of aging meat. Finally, in the harbourside village of Mousehole, Rick meets a potter who finds inspiration from the local landscape

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson and podcaster Rosie Ramsey visit a forest camp in Northumberland set up to help Army veterans, where they sign up for a bushcraft lesson, attempt to build a shelter and make a fire. They also enjoy a buggy race, before Robson meets the horses whose company can help in the treatment of anxiety

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple to find a home in the Norfolk countryside for 700,000, and gets a glimpse of the latest Lotus hypercar, which is manufactured in the area

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: After worrying her autism would stop her developing her skills, Belinda has become a talented glassblower with the potential to turn her art into a money-making business. Paul and Becky have a passion for upcycling furniture and are hoping to turn their hobby into a day job. Dom Chinea and his team of experts meets all three makers and helps them to make their aspirations a reality

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Roo Irvine and Mark Hill take a tour of the Highlands. A rare piece of glass and a penny bank go under the gavel, and one of Scotland's strongest men helps the pair on their way

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Freddie demands the truth about his dad's identity but Kat won't tell. Stacey is on high alert around the men of Walford and tension rises between the Knight sisters as Anna secretly meets with a private investigator

programme.title: What They Really Mean For You
programme.desc: Justin Rowlatt, Michelle Ackerley and Dr Tara Shine investigate the eco-friendly alternatives to oil and gas boilers and if it's possible to build an entirely low-carbon electricity network before the government's net zero target of 2050. Justin explores a futuristic house in Salford that is used to test new heating technologies in extreme conditions. Michelle gets an insight into how heat pumps are installed and the cost of doing so. Tara meets the gas company promoting hydrogen as the solution to home heating and finds out if it is a feasible option

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: A vet finds something trapped in the intestines of Bear the lost dog. Jack delves deeper into the Donkey Pitch case and becomes convinced there was a second killer

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Gaia: A Death on Dancing Ledge
programme.desc: Zara McDermott investigates a mysterious death from 2017, in which a 19-year-old from Dorset ran away from home in a state of distress. Her body would later be found in the undergrowth by a massive search operation, having died of hypothermia. The first episode examines the early clues that were discovered and the suspicion that fell on a childhood friend and his grandmother, before they were released without charge

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Manville researches her family tree. So far as her mother's side is concerned, by delving deep into Brighton's local archives, Lesley uncovers a complex story of wartime separation, adultery and the inaccessibility of divorce. Tracing back her father's line sees Lesley trying to solve what happened to her ancestor Aaron Harding. A widower with a large family to feed, Aaron protested poor conditions and pay as an agricultural worker in 1830 - a protest that would become known as the Swing Riots. He was arrested and subsequently transported to Australia

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An unusual licence plate helps police crack an international smuggling operation and a call about a disturbance leads officers to discover a huge haul of firearms. A group of youths smoking cannabis leads to the solving of a string of robberies

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in Koala Creek as kidney disease claims the life of Wilpena, but there is also happier news on the marsupial front when Ben and Kate catch up with wallaby Newt

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a grand five-bedroom Victorian terrace in Brighton. Plus, the progress of houses in Beeston in Nottinghamshire and Welwyn Garden City in Hertfordshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts David Harper and Raj Bisram guide the red and the blue teams around Ardingly Antiques Fair, West Sussex, before the teams take their items to auction. Natasha also visits an elaborate well, a gift from a Maharajah, opened in 1864

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Tintagel, Cornwall's most mythical place, which was an important trading port with Europe and the birthplace of perhaps Britain's greatest legend - the tale of King Arthur. He also learns how the Methodists were important to Cornwall, and how they would cook a rather unusual bun during feast days, and meets a family on the Roseland Peninsula who are continuing the surprisingly ancient tradition of growing an exotic spice - saffron

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Former Emmerdale actress Charlie Hardwick shows Robson the hidden gems of the East Durham coastline. The pair take an art class on the sand, a wellness choir teacher shows how singing outdoors can be good for mind and body, and Robson signs up for a session with a forest bathing instructor among the trees of Hamsterley Forest

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple who want to find a property in the Welsh Borders, preferably with holiday let potential or space for a glamping, on a budget of 1million

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Labourer Mike has a passion for turning wooden bowls but feels held back by his perfectionist attitude to his creations. During the pandemic Sarah quit her job and took up pottery but has been struggling to make enough money from it to live on. With the help and advice of Dom Chinea and his team of experts, Mike and Sarah try their best to create smooth running businesses out of their crafts and turn their hobbies into a day job

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Roo Irvine and Mark Hill continue their Scottish jaunt as a 1970s Triumph transports the duo to shops scattered throughout the Highlands. A Georgian silver brooch gives veteran Tripper Roo something solemn to think about, but a rather unorthodox key rack, she hopes, will unlock some big profits. Meanwhile, rookie Tripper Mark continues to buy like an old hand as he finds a wooden sculpture of a naked torso that makes for an exhilarating auction

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Freddie meets his dad and Kat finally tells him the truth. Elaine hatches a plan to get the Knight sisters to steal customers from the Albert but Gina is rattled when Anna brings up their mum again

programme.title: Barra's Return of the Wild
programme.desc: Barra Best meets one of the volunteers ensuring the Northern Bald Ibis continues to exist in the German town of Burghausen. Off the coast of County Kerry, Ireland, investigations are carried out into the presence of super-sized oysters in the Atlantic Ocean and the part they play in saving the oceans' diversity. A group of bison in Sweden are relocated to the wilds of Romania

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Photographer Brock Elbank takes images of Araf, Scotland's first Asian paramedic, who also works with local mosques and gurdwaras, equipping them with first-aid knowledge and providing a bridge between communities. Brock's photographic projects focus on idiosyncratic and unique features, such as scars, birthmarks and skin conditions such as vitiligo, to capture the private stories behind a public persona

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Reality star Dani Dyer, actor James Buckley, comedian Marcus Brigstocke, former Gogglebox star Mica Ven and TV and radio presenter Richie Anderson compete in the first heat of the celebrity contest. The first challenge sees the contestants each given a different ingredient to showcase in a single dish. Then they have to make a main course and a dessert for a dinner party, knowing that John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be sending one of them home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ulster By the Sea
programme.desc: Jon thanks the managers at Shanlieve caravan park in Cranfield for saving his life after he suffered a heart attack two years ago. Catherine and Rick, also at Cranfield, go out to award the annual best-kept caravan prizes, while their son Miles goes paddle-boarding with his friends. Jo's family enjoy a summer of harbour jumping at Carnlough and Colin takes to the road in his brightly painted caravan

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena and Amy meet a white industry executive famed for successful films and TV shows with black talent. Kwabena persuades him to read his script, only to suspect that his ideas have been stolen. Kwabena also meets Vanessa's wealthy friends, Amy continues to struggle with microaggressions at work, and Maurice decides to go vegan. Guest starring Jessica Hynes and Isy Suttie

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Funmi goes into labour, but when the doctors refuse to listen to her concerns, she ends up forced into an emergency c-section that leaves her life hanging in the balance. A baby on the way means Kwabena desperately needs somewhere new to live, but given his financial situation, and the housing crisis in London, it's proving difficult. Stephanie is worried about her son, a cheeky, aspiring rapper who has fallen in with the wrong crowd

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League striker Kevin Campbell, European champion sprinter Adam Gemili, Ashes-winning cricketer Ashley Giles and world 800m and 4x400m bronze medallist Jenny Meadows join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to actor and film-maker Kenneth Branagh In a wide-ranging conversation, Branagh reveals some of his most formative artistic experiences and his creative process. He remembers his working class upbringing in late 1960s Northern Ireland at the start of the Troubles, as explored in his most personal film to date, Belfast. Branagh also traces the beginnings of his love for Shakespeare back to the discovery of LP recordings of Laurence Olivier and John Gielgud, and reveals his admiration for Thomas Hardy and the Alan Bleasdale's 1980s television series The Boys from the Blackstuff

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to actor and film-maker Kenneth Branagh In a wide-ranging conversation, Branagh reveals some of his most formative artistic experiences and his creative process. He remembers his working class upbringing in late 1960s Northern Ireland at the start of the Troubles, as explored in his most personal film to date, Belfast. Branagh also traces the beginnings of his love for Shakespeare back to the discovery of LP recordings of Laurence Olivier and John Gielgud, and reveals his admiration for Thomas Hardy and the Alan Bleasdale's 1980s television series The Boys from the Blackstuff

programme.title: Rita is Crogall
programme.desc: Rita and Crocodile go on a skiing trip. They whizz up and down the mountains, but Crocodile is the fastest

programme.title: Damhan & Durrag/Pipas & Douglas
programme.desc: Is this going to be gymnastics?

programme.title: Alba Eagalach
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Dave and Petronella use some hi-tech equipment in their search for paranormal activity at Culzean Castle

programme.title: Bogaisean is Gumbalan/Bottersnikes and Gumbles
programme.desc: Tink becomes consumed with a golden seat, but the King is after it also, after being told by Bgais-shd that it holds great powers

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: The competitors are very lively, as they take part in hurdling

programme.title: Na Dana-thursan aig Tintin/The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: The monks from the monastery save Tintin, while Chang is located. An honour is bestowed upon Tintin for all his efforts in finding his friend

programme.title: An Solas Buan (Lighthouses of Scotland)
programme.desc: Profile of Robert Stevenson, an engineer who formed relationships with leading designers and became a renowned lighthouse architect in the process. Examples of his work featured include Bell Rock, the Isle of May, Sumburgh and Girdle Ness

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Calum Maclean is in Glasgow taking a step back in time along the banks of the River Clyde, and Joy Dunlop meets learners Audrey and Davy Paterson from Taynuilt

programme.title: Rum Gu Rum, Le Erica
programme.desc: Actress turned-interior-designer Erica Morrison goes on a design adventure throughout the Highlands and Islands, with the help of local craft workers

programme.title: Trusadh (Compelling Stories)
programme.desc: Mairi Ross from the Isle of Lewis learns about Scotland's native horses, having been passionate about horses since the age of three. She embarks on a journey where she meets like-minded people who care deeply about the different breeds, and finds out what they are doing to preserve their numbers going into the future

programme.title: Bannan (The Ties That Bind)
programme.desc: Alasdair comes back home to Miri and Anna and they begin to get to know their 'new' mother-in-law and granny, Iseabail. Cailean suspects that there is more going on than meets the eye and wants to know more about this new woman. He is pleasantly distracted with the arrival of his wife Sarah Jane, back from the city with her niece Isla. Miri is delighted to see her teenage friend Sarah Jane again, but wants to know why their friendship came to such a sudden end. Sarah Jane reluctantly reveals why - leaving Mairi stunned

programme.title: Farpaisean Chon-Chaorach (Sheepdog Trials)
programme.desc: Donald MacSween and Catriona MacPhee present highlights from the International Sheepdog Trials 2021, staged in Aberystwyth

programme.title: Mach Seo!
programme.desc: An action-packed trip to Skye's Trotternish peninsula with Ramsay MacMahon, including a hike up the Old Man of Storr and a trip to Staffin Bay

programme.title: Fuine (Home Baking)
programme.desc: Gregor MacLeod and home bakers from across Scotland share tasty recipes for specific diets. Gregor tastes an egg and dairy-free chocolate cake that doesn't compromise on flavour and is still the ultimate chocolatey treat. Gregor gets a slice of a gluten free orange polenta cake which uses almonds instead of flour and back in his own kitchen, Gregor makes a tasty vegan pie layered with colourful vegetables cooked in spices and herbs

programme.desc: Po is deceived by the members of a dance troupe who are actually a gang of thieves

programme.title: Bogaisean is Gumbalan/Bottersnikes and Gumbles
programme.desc: Tink becomes consumed with a golden seat, but the King is after it also, after being told by Bgais-shd that it holds great powers

programme.title: Na Dana-thursan aig Tintin/The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: When Tintin and the detectives get lost in the desert, the situation regarding the fuel explosions becomes clearer

programme.title: An Solas Buan (Lighthouses of Scotland)
programme.desc: Profile of Robert Stevenson, an engineer who formed relationships with leading designers and became a renowned lighthouse architect in the process. Examples of his work featured include Bell Rock, the Isle of May, Sumburgh and Girdle Ness

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Joy Dunlop meets circus performer and Gaelic learner Kit Rodman-Orr from Cumbernauld, and Calum Maclean takes a voyage of discovery to an unusual theatre

programme.title: An L (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC ALBA

programme.title: An Lot (The Croft)
programme.desc: Donald Macsween is back with a special series from his croft in Ness. Cameras follow him from the beginning of the year and into lockdown, getting his thoughts on how the coronavirus has impacted him in his job as a full-time crofter

programme.title: Farpaisean Chon-Chaorach (Sheepdog Trials)
programme.desc: The International Sheep Dog Trial in Aberystwyth, where four nations battle it out to win the team competition, and the handlers strive to be Supreme champion for 2021

programme.title: OMC!
programme.desc: Sketch show featuring a collection of comic characters, spoofs, warring acquaintances and a citizenship test that asks all the key questions

programme.title: Lifesavers - An Ostair
programme.desc: Focusing on developments that have helped to save the lives of transplant patients - an area in which the recently unthinkable is now possible

programme.title: An t-Inneal Espresso/The Espresso Machine
programme.desc: Drama revolving around a high-end espresso machine. Ealasaid loaned her machine to Ailig's girlfriend Una, and desperately wants it back. Unfortunately, Ailig and Una just broke up

programme.title: Bannan (The Ties That Bind)
programme.desc: Alasdair comes back home to Miri and Anna and they begin to get to know their 'new' mother-in-law and granny, Iseabail. Cailean suspects that there is more going on than meets the eye and wants to know more about this new woman. He is pleasantly distracted with the arrival of his wife Sarah Jane, back from the city with her niece Isla. Miri is delighted to see her teenage friend Sarah Jane again, but wants to know why their friendship came to such a sudden end. Sarah Jane reluctantly reveals why - leaving Mairi stunned

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Japan v Spain (Kick-off 8.00am). All the action from the final match in Group C for both teams, held at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand. Japan won this tournament in 2011 and were runners-up in 2015, but Spain are currently six places above them in the FIFA World Rankings in seventh. Michelle Owen presents, with analysis from Vicky Losada and Eni Aluko

programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Monica Galetti for a culinary journey around Oxford, where they pay a visit to Raymond Blanc at his restaurant Le Manoir aux Quat'Saisons, and sample some of his award-winning dishes. They take a trip up the river to a farm where they pick raspberries for a pudding, and James prepares a chicken dish with morels in the grounds of Raymond's restaurant

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Dean and Johnny from London, Bev and Tony from Eccles and Belfast couple Aaron and Joe use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to potentially double the money they've banked earlier in the show or leave with nothing. Hosted by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Paul, Alex, Catherine and Harriett pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but if anyone is caught they're out for good, leaving fewer players for the final chase

programme.desc: Dan's mind races, and Wendy tells him they might be bringing Lloyd out of his coma. Claudette is worried when weary Victor collapses

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Adam's gender reveal party takes Sarah by surprise, Carla provides Ryan with some unwanted exposure, the Alahans hold a memorial dinner, and mum is the word for Eliza

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follows the stories of two women looking for siblings given up for adoption, but for very different reasons. Jeanette Woodyatt wants to find the brother she has never met and who was turned away from the family by her grandmother, while Karen Turnbull yearns to let her twin siblings know that their mother gave them up for adoption so they would have a better life

programme.title: Unstoppable (2010)
programme.desc: A driverless train carrying a deadly cargo of toxic chemicals goes out of control. Action thriller, the final film from director Tony Scott, starring Denzel Washington, Chris Pine and Rosario Dawson

programme.title: Made in Britain
