programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Portugal v USA (Kick-off 8.00am). All the action from both teams' final match in Group E, held at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. America are the reigning champions and will expect to claim three points against a team playing in their first World Cup finals. Michelle Owen presents, with analysis from Kim Little and Vicky Losada, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lucy Ward

programme.title: Ainsley's World Cup Flavours
programme.desc: Cookery show in which chef Ainsley Harriott combines food and football, making dishes from around the world for celebrity guests. Ainsley kicks things off by serving up an Argentinian bavette steak for former England manager Sam Allardyce and ITV Sport's Mark Pougatch, while singer Olly Murs drops in and lends a hand making a German doner kebab and chatting about his new music

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: China v England (Kick-off 12.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from both teams' third and final Group D encounter, held at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. The only previous meeting between the sides was in 2015 when China claimed a 2-1 home win in a friendly, but the Lionesses will be hopeful of a victory on this occasion after winning Euro 2022 and finishing four in this tournament in 2019. With analysis from Karen Carney and Eni Aluko, reports from Katie Shanahan and Jill Scott and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Emma Hayes

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present day one of the festival, including the 4.35 Goodwood Cup, plus races at 2.50, 3.25 and 4.00. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Megan Nicholls, reports by Luke Harvey, Mark Heyes, Oli Bell and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Jonathan, Gemma, Charlotte and Barclay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Amelia is in turmoil, Nate is left feeling like a failure, and Nicola is excited to hear her new bus stop is finished

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul meets 13-year-old Noah, who has checked into the neurology ward ahead of an operation to correct a structural defect of the skull. The youngster needs to overcome his anxiety, however, so Paul joins him on a fun tour aimed at demystifying surgical theatres. Other children include seven-year-old Oliver, a long-term patient who is struggling to walk after being struck down by arthritis, and 17-year-old Rue, who has lost much of her sight and is now using various gadgets to re-learn many everyday tasks

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Swindon to surprise Lorraine, a retired RAF servicewoman and devoted charity volunteer. Because of a spinal injury, Lorraine struggles with mobility issues and lives with her full-time support team - Leonbergers Poppy and Doris. Poppy is a retired therapy dog and Doris is Lorraine's assistance dog, and helps with chores such as laundry and fetching household items. The team creates a fabulous low-maintenance garden as a calming retreat for both Lorraine and her canine family

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the celebrity cookery series. This time, the remaining celebrity contestants prepare dishes inspired by French cuisine as they battle it out for a place in the grand final

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: One week into the Covid lockdown in 2020, builder Rob murders his legal secretary wife Kelly and their two children before turning the gun on himself. Kelly's identical twin sister, who is 160 miles away, senses that something is wrong immediately. Using text messages, family archive, and interviews with friends, family, the police and Emma - Kelly's twin sister - this episode looks at the downward spiral of coercive control and gun laws that led to a family's horrific death

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Spice Trail Adventure
programme.desc: The last leg of Joanna Lumley's journey takes her by dhow to Zanzibar, the spice island of Africa where merchants from around the world have left their mark on the architecture, religion and music. Finally, she travels to Jordan where the spice trail continued on land. She explores the vast plains of Wadi Rum from the back of a camel, meets one of the last nomadic Bedouin families and visits Za'atari refugee camp, home to Jordan's newest arrivals. Her journey ends at the one of the great wonders of the world, the ancient city of Petra

programme.title: Karen Carney's Leaders of the Pack
programme.desc: Former England international Karen Carney presents the series that shines a light on the incredible achievements of female footballers on and off the pitch. This time, Karen catches up with Melchie Dumornay, to learn about the exceptional story of a girl who beat all the odds to lead her country to their first-ever Women's World Cup finals

programme.title: Romeo & Duet
programme.desc: Oti Mabuse presents the dating show that uses the power of singing to help people find their ideal partners, with Michael, Liv, Callum and Sandy taking part this time. Each of the four new couples then compete to be crowned the winners by the studio audience and bag themselves a second date

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Omid Djalili, in which contestants Duncan, Tracey, Val, Frank, Freddie, Diana, Kate, Pierrette and Lawrence are assigned a number between one and nine. They are then whittled down to a final four, and the combination of numbers they are assigned represents the size of the jackpot they play to win in a final round

programme.title: On Assignment
programme.desc: Rohit Kachroo travels to East London and finds a grieving community still seeking answers in the wake of the deaths of 21 teenagers in a South African nightclub. Ellie Pitt examines a new Spanish law that requires employers to give paid 'menstrual leave' to women who suffer from disabling periods, and Amy Lewis travels to Slovenia to explore how the country is trying to shake off its past

programme.title: Karen Carney's Leaders of the Pack
programme.desc: Former England international Karen Carney presents the series that shines a light on the incredible achievements of female footballers on and off the pitch. programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at autumn in the northern hemisphere and spring in the south, seasons of change that bring opportunities, but also huge challenges. By September temperatures in northern Canada can plummet as low as -20C, but there is one stretch of river that still flows and bears are able to fish for the final salmon of the season. In southern Africa the rains have been gone for many months and watering holes have all-but dried up, while a king penguin chick on Marion Island answers the call of the ocean

programme.title: Kate Garraway's Life Stories
programme.desc: Kate Garraway is joined by entertainer, author and Strictly Come Dancing star Anton Du Beke. From his struggles growing up on a council estate in Kent to winning a National Television Award for best TV judge, Kate delves into Du Beke's remarkable rise from a provincial dance school to one of the biggest shows on British television. But behind the showbiz sparkle, we'll hear how Anton went through many years of struggle, some of which he speaks about for the very first time

programme.desc: Trainee FBI agent Clarice Starling is sent to interview an imprisoned psychopath with a taste for eating his victims. programme.desc: Paul meets 13-year-old Noah, who has checked into the neurology ward ahead of an operation to correct a structural defect of the skull. The youngster needs to overcome his anxiety, however, so Paul joins him on a fun tour aimed at demystifying surgical theatres. Other children include seven-year-old Oliver, a long-term patient who is struggling to walk after being struck down by arthritis, and 17-year-old Rue, who has lost much of her sight and is now using various gadgets to re-learn many everyday tasks

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Swindon to surprise Lorraine, a retired RAF servicewoman and devoted charity volunteer. Because of a spinal injury, Lorraine struggles with mobility issues and lives with her full-time support team - Leonbergers Poppy and Doris. Poppy is a retired therapy dog and Doris is Lorraine's assistance dog, and helps with chores such as laundry and fetching household items. The team creates a fabulous low-maintenance garden as a calming retreat for both Lorraine and her canine family

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the celebrity cookery series. This time, the remaining celebrity contestants prepare dishes inspired by French cuisine as they battle it out for a place in the grand final

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: One week into the Covid lockdown in 2020, builder Rob murders his legal secretary wife Kelly and their two children before turning the gun on himself. Kelly's identical twin sister, who is 160 miles away, senses that something is wrong immediately. Using text messages, family archive, and interviews with friends, family, the police and Emma - Kelly's twin sister - this episode looks at the downward spiral of coercive control and gun laws that led to a family's horrific death

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Spice Trail Adventure
programme.desc: The last leg of Joanna Lumley's journey takes her by dhow to Zanzibar, the spice island of Africa where merchants from around the world have left their mark on the architecture, religion and music. Finally, she travels to Jordan where the spice trail continued on land. She explores the vast plains of Wadi Rum from the back of a camel, meets one of the last nomadic Bedouin families and visits Za'atari refugee camp, home to Jordan's newest arrivals. Her journey ends at the one of the great wonders of the world, the ancient city of Petra

programme.title: Karen Carney's Leaders of the Pack
programme.desc: Former England international Karen Carney presents the series that shines a light on the incredible achievements of female footballers on and off the pitch. This time, Karen catches up with Melchie Dumornay, to learn about the exceptional story of a girl who beat all the odds to lead her country to their first-ever Women's World Cup finals

programme.title: Romeo & Duet

Each of the singletons will be serenaded by up to four singers and if they like what they hear they make their way to the bottom of the stairs to choose their favourite, opening the door and locking in their choice before the performance comes to an end. Each of the four new couples then compete to be crowned the winners by the studio audience and bag themselves a second date

programme.title: Winning Combination

programme.title: On Assignment
programme.desc: Rohit Kachroo travels to East London and finds a grieving community still seeking answers in the wake of the deaths of 21 teenagers in a South African nightclub. Ellie Pitt examines a new Spanish law that requires employers to give paid 'menstrual leave' to women who suffer from disabling periods, and Amy Lewis travels to Slovenia to explore how the country is trying to shake off its past

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at autumn in the northern hemisphere and spring in the south, seasons of change that bring opportunities, but also huge challenges. By September temperatures in northern Canada can plummet as low as -20C, but there is one stretch of river that still flows and bears are able to fish for the final salmon of the season. In southern Africa the rains have been gone for many months and watering holes have all-but dried up, while a king penguin chick on Marion Island answers the call of the ocean

programme.desc: Stan gets amnesia after falling off an arcade game during a CIA operation and Francine sees it as the perfect opportunity to mould him into her ideal husband. Meanwhile, Steve is drawn into the corrupt side of Roger's paper route business.

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: Stand-up routines with Russell Hicks, Felicity Ward, Toussaint Douglass, Luke McQueen, Huge Davies, Finlay Christie, Jessie Cave and Steen Raskopoulos

programme.title: Iain Stirling's CelebAbility
programme.desc: The hilarious Iain Stirling is joined by returning team captain Scarlett Moffat as she leads a group of three friends looking to win a slew of fabulous prizes by defeating four celebrities - Eyal Booker, Sophie Hermann, Lou Sanders and Seann Walsh - in a series of silly games based on the unusual abilities the celebs believe they possess.

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson narrates a selection of some of the most incredible and peculiar record-breaking attempts, featuring the longest motorcycle jump, the loudest burp and the tightest parallel parking. He also reveals the oddest record in the book

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ashley follows Laurel to the airport, determined to declare his feelings and talk her out of leaving the village. Zoe dashes Terry's hopes of rebuilding his career at Home Farm

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ashley jets off to be reunited with Laurel in Finland, unaware she's returned to the village. Terry keeps Dawn in the dark about what happened at Home Farm

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve makes a public declaration of love for Karen at Underworld, and a furious Deirdre rounds on Dev for hurting her daughter

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Just when Steve looks like he's making progress with Karen, his jealousy gets the better of him and he ends up pushing her into Joe's arms

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon and Oliver forge an uneasy pact when they learn that Lyn is pregnant, but tensions arise when they are interviewed on a local radio station

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon and Oliver return to a bachelor existence, now that their children have finally flown the coop. Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on Adam over missing hospital funds and Mike attends a meeting to assess the mental welfare of a 50-year-old man (guest Andrew Dunn) who still lives with his mother. Elsewhere, Gordon's former father-in-law pays an unexpected visit with sobering news and Ken makes a confession to his colleagues. Guest starring Michael Jayston

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Jill becomes unwell after receiving the results of a pregnancy test. Elsewhere, when a baby goes missing, suspicion falls on the parents of a girl admitted with a broken ankle. Meanwhile, Gordon makes a discovery about a diabetic patient that explains his behaviour and, in a dramatic finale, tragedy looms. Daniel Casey guest stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve comes to the aid of an amnesiac struggling to piece together his identity, Jenny tells Dennis she is tired of playing second fiddle to his career, and Bernie and David step in when it appears Vernon's money-making schemes are getting the better of him. Rural drama, starring James Carlton, Ian East, Peter Benson, David Lonsdale and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Alf Ventress mounts a large-scale surveillance operation in an effort to track down the wool thief responsible for de-fleecing sheep in Aidensfield. Bernie finds himself in hot water when an estranged son arrives to bury his father - who is already six feet under. Drama, starring James Carlton and Peter Benson

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel and Ashley are finally reunited, Steph throws her weight around at the factory, while Zak consoles Terry with a few well-chosen words of wisdom

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn reacts angrily to the discovery that Terry has lost his job, Laurel and Ashley get used to the idea of being a couple, and Syd catches Chloe trying to chat up curate Ethan

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve tries to make life difficult for Karen and Joe, but his actions only end up backfiring. Gail gets a call from her solicitor about her finances

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail is left devastated after a meeting with her solicitor. Steve hits rock bottom, having to endure Janice regaling him with tales of how happy Karen and Joe are together

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The apparent accidental death of a drug addict takes a surprising turn when the results of the post-mortem examination are revealed, and Jack finds himself confronting his own chequered past. Ewen Bremner guest-stars, with David Jason

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A serious assault leads the police to foil an attempt to steal antiques from Ashfordly Hall, and Vernon goes all-out to persuade a wealthy woman to make a charitable contribution toward his donkey sanctuary - but the discovery that there is already one in the area forces him to change his plans. Meanwhile, Merton devises a solution to Ventress's retirement worries. Rosemary Leach guest stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The Aidensfield police are puzzled when it seems a face from the past has become the unlikely victim of vandalism, and suspicions are soon aroused over the reasons for his sudden return to the village. Meanwhile, Vernon encounters dangerous wildlife as he stashes his capital in Ashfordly woods, but decides to turn the incident into another money-making scheme. Geoffrey Hughes stars

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: In the summer of 1967, Morse and Thursday are both devastated by Joan's abrupt departure from Oxford. The young detective responds to his loss by throwing himself into his work, investigating the suspicious drowning of a scientist who was part of a research team working on an early computer. At first it appears to be a simple suicide - until two more bodies are found in the river

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: DS Sam Casey, a young officer with a strong sense of justice, is brought in to investigate the shooting of Devlin outside the Old Bailey, and is surprised to learn the gunman was specifically targeting police officers. The case sees the whole team emotionally spent, with the trial itself at risk of being derailed by a politically driven defence lawyer (Colin Salmon) with an axe to grind. Crime drama, starring Bradley Walsh, Freema Agyeman and Paul Nicholls, who joins the cast

programme.desc: The mysterious shooting of archaeology student Celia Dawe and the significance of matching playing cards lead Wycliffe on a manhunt across Cornwall. Police drama based on the novel by WJ Burley, guest starring Bill Nighy alongside Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale

Rural police drama, starring Duncan Bell, Peter Benson and Geoffrey Hughes

The occasion soon unleashes scandal, romance and intrigue - leaving the future of Downton hanging in the balance. Director Michael Engler's drama based on the TV series, starring Hugh Bonneville, Michelle Dockery and Maggie Smith

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Two-part drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson and based on the novel by Peter Robinson. DCI Alan Banks investigates the most difficult case of his life when five girls go missing but only four bodies are found. Chief suspect Marcus Payne is in a coma, and ambitious DS Annie Cabbot from the Professional Standards department pursues Banks in an effort to find out why. Andrea Lowe and Charlotte Riley also star

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Conclusion. The mysterious death of serial killer Marcus Payne makes the task of finding his accomplice more difficult and holds up the search for Leanne Wray. With time against him and DS Annie Cabbot breathing down his neck, Banks follows a hunch and takes Payne's wife in for questioning on suspicion of involvement with the rape and murder of the four girls. The lead she provides is more startling than anything the detectives are prepared for. Drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, with Charlotte Riley and Andrea Lowe

programme.desc: A girl disappears, prompting the police to begin a desperate search, convinced her errant father has snatched her. Tamzin Outhwaite guest stars as uncompromising lawyer Miriam Pescatore

programme.desc: A look at double glazing at a UPVC recycling plant, the ancient art of milling for a Welsh Bara Brith, Sheffield steel for Olympic ice skates and a craftsman making banjos

programme.desc: The Sheriff of Nottingham tries to avoid paying his debts to a Jewish moneylender by inciting a riot. Fantasy drama, starring Michael Praed

programme.desc: Higgins, TC and Rick witness an armed robbery at prestigious nightspot the King Kamehameha Club, but hamper Thomas's attempts to investigate by giving conflicting - and highly embroidered - accounts of what happened. Tom Selleck stars

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A crook arranges the conversion of replica firearms into the real thing and sells them on to small-time hoodlums. Crime drama, starring John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mr. Brick has decided to cook some of the lovely childhood meals his mother used to make, and share them with the kids at school. However, their half-power turns everything they touch into vegetables! Which gets Sam in a real pickle when she convinces herself that, as a result of that power, she has turned Stella into a carrot!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam decides to do her 3-day-workplace-discovery internship with her father, Percy, with hopes of sending the first PDRA into space: Hammy. Mo, on the other hand, hasn't even looked for an internship, utterly convinced that his father will give him one in Town Hall, on the day itself. Unfortunately, JC beat him to the punch and since Mr. Brick has strictly prohibited two internships at the same place, Mo winds up with none at all!

programme.desc: When Scooby and the gang are investigating one of the most haunted mansions in the historic Hollywood Hills they meet up with none-other than famous actor George Takei. His house is next door and he's hoping to save this abandoned old mansion as a historic landmark. programme.title: Mr Magoo

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Weasel, disguised as a supervillain atop a building under construction, has taken the President hostage. While Fizz prepares to act out a heroic rescue, Magoo appears in a ski suit and mistakes Weasel for a yeti.

programme.title: Mr Magoo

Meanwhile, party lovers from London who save every year to go to Benidorm together find themselves in the lap of luxury on a trip that sees them in the slowpaced confines of a five-star Caribbean hotel on the island of St Lucia. Each holiday is exactly what the respective groups normally avoid

programme.title: Never Teach Your Wife to Drive
programme.desc: Documentary following three women who are learning how to drive under instruction from their partners, with the drama and mayhem of the lessons putting added strain on their relationships. In Hertfordshire, Becky's tendency to put her foot down on the accelerator and severe lack of spatial awareness leaves Greg stressed out, while John begins by taking Yasmin out for endless spins around a car park in Wigan. In Guisborough, North Yorkshire, Matt's high levels of patience are tested as he teaches his hot-tempered wife Yaveli the rules of the road

programme.title: The Moon with Dara O Briain
programme.desc: Part one of two. The comedian explores the ways in which the moon shapes just about everything around us, and why there is now a new race to get humans back to the surface of our satellite. In this edition, Dara travels to the coasts of Kent to meet astrobiologist Professor Lewis Dartnell to find out just how far the moon's influence on life on Earth extends. Later, he meets Dr Rohin Francis to dig deeper into the myths surrounding the moon's influence on human behaviour, and to discuss some of the latest evidence

programme.title: Ben Fogle's Lost Worlds
programme.desc: The traveller heads to Cyprus to spend a week with the UN's Peacekeeping Force, who patrol the enormous buffer zone on the island, keeping the Turkish and Greek Cypriot communities separated. Ben is on a mission to understand more about the so-called 'Cyprus Problem', visiting ghost towns left behind, learning how criminal gangs profit from the division and hearing often tragic stories from people on both sides whose lives have been devastated by the conflict

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: PC Andy Doran makes his way to the scene of a collision on the A6, where a tired young driver has fallen asleep at the wheel and crashed his car into a lamp post. On the edge of the Peak District, PC Amy Hollis is on the scene of a crash where a car has come off the road and hit a bridge 60ft above a river

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The programme follows officers from Derbyshire's road crime unit as they target dealers bringing drugs into the county, with PC Nick Lovatt giving chase after a sighting of a suspected dealer in Derby. At police HQ, the cops receive intelligence about a van travelling towards Derbyshire suspected of carrying a large amount of cash. The Road Crime Unit heads into position to intercept the van and surround it on the motorway

programme.title: Alex Polizzi's Italian Islands
programme.desc: Alex continues her tour with a visit to the smaller islands of southern Italy. She starts out on Capri, which, with its beauty, glamour and history, has been a celebrated holiday destination since Roman times. She enjoys its signature style, which she claims has never gone out of fashion. On Ischia, she scales the rocky heights of the medieval Aragonese Castle, before hopping across to the remote Aeolian island of Salina, where she samples the famous Malvasia wine. Finally she travels to Filicudi, an island that holds a special place in her heart

programme.title: The Moon with Dara O Briain
programme.desc: Part two of two. The comedian continues his exploration Earth's satellite. He visits Jodrell Bank, home of the UK's largest radio telescope, to recall how the first photograph of the far side of the moon was taken in the 1950s, before travelling to Cologne in Germany to meet Samantha Cristoforetti, a European astronaut who hopes to one day walk on the moon

programme.title: Inside the Force: 24/7
programme.desc: Response officers Sgt Mike Templeman and PC Becky Hill deal with a series of assaults, including a racially aggravated attack in the city centre and an incident that has left a flat covered in blood. They deal with a large fight that has broken out at a nightclub at 3.30am, and before the night is over, one of the officers will be bitten on the leg by a man who claims to have Hepatitis C

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: Roads Policing Officer PC Merchant is on patrol on the M5 when he spots a man driving while watching something on his phone, and pulls the driver over. programme.title: Great British Ships
programme.desc: Rob Bell investigates the history of ocean liner the SS Queen Mary, finding out how the largest ship of its day could also become the fastest - achieving speeds that few large ships can match even 80 years later. On the passenger decks, he savours the art deco craftsmanship that made the vessel the much-loved 'floating gentleman's club', where royalty rubbed shoulders with movie stars

programme.title: Alex Polizzi's Italian Islands
programme.desc: Alex continues her tour with a visit to the north of Sicily, revealing a different side to the largest island in the Mediterranean. She discovers overwhelming opulence at a palace in Palermo, meets an inspirational mayor and viewing an army of mummified monks who are giving scientists new insights into island life in the past. She also learns how the Mafia have influenced Sicilian life for decades from a group of locals determined to bring about change

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is pulling a truckload of coconuts in India, where he comes across a mysterious Monkey Temple and encounters some cheeky monkeys

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Tracker dreams that Mayor Humdinger has turned into a baby. Then it falls to the pups to find the special coconut to reverse the spell

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Muppets from Space (1999)
programme.desc: Gonzo hits the road with pal Rizzo in tow and goes in search of his roots - only to make the amazing discovery that his parents belonged to a race of aliens. He then has to choose whether to board a UFO and return to his family, or stay with the friends he knows and loves. Family comedy, with F Murray Abraham, David Arquette, Ray Liotta, Andie MacDowell and Rob Schneider alongside the puppets

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon (2010)
programme.desc: A clumsy Viking boy longs to become a mighty dragon slayer and protect his village from the fearsome flying lizards, but his father thinks he is not up to the task. However, when he sets out to prove his worth, he ends up befriending a dragon, and realises his people may have misjudged the creatures. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Jay Baruchel and Gerard Butler

programme.title: The Man in the White Suit (1951)
programme.desc: A put-upon chemist's invention of an indestructible dirt-proof fibre brings him into conflict with clothing industry moguls who foresee their profits disappearing down the drain - and promptly vow to put a stop to his plans. Satirical Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood, Cecil Parker and Michael Gough

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad (1974)
programme.desc: A swashbuckling sailor stumbles across a golden tablet that forms part of a map revealing the way to a magic fountain, which is fabled to bestow untold riches and eternal youth. But first the brave mariner has to battle storms, monsters and the trickery of an evil wizard before he can reach his goal. Fantasy adventure, with John Phillip Law, Tom Baker, Douglas Wilmer, Martin Shaw and Caroline Munro, with effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: A Good Year (2006)
programme.desc: A city trader inherits a French vineyard from his deceased uncle. But when he goes to France to get a valuation on his newly acquired property so he can sell it, a series of unexpected events leads him to reassess his priorities in life. Ridley Scott's comedy drama based on Peter Mayle's novel, starring Russell Crowe, Albert Finney, Abbie Cornish and Marion Cotillard

programme.title: Underwater (2020)
programme.desc: Nora Price is a mechanical engineer at the Kepler drilling station, seven miles beneath the surface of the Pacific Ocean. She and a small crew fight for survival after a tremor causes catastrophic failures to the base's integrity. Meanwhile, in the inky void, something unspeakable lurks, waiting to attack. Sci-fi thriller, starring Kristen Stewart, Mamoudou Athie and Vincent Cassell

programme.title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines (2003)
programme.desc: John Connor finds his destiny to lead the human race in a future war is catching up with him when an advanced new Terminator in female form is sent back in time to eliminate him. However, a reprogrammed cyborg has also been dispatched to act as his protector. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Nick Stahl, Claire Danes and Kristanna Loken

programme.title: American Woman (2018)
programme.desc: In a small blue-collar town in Pennsylvania lives Debra Callahan, a 32-year-old woman's whose teenage daughter Bridget goes missing. Left to raise her infant grandson alone, Debra seeks the answers behind Bridget's disappearance. Director Jake Scott's drama, starring Sienna Miller, Christina Hendricks, Sky Ferreira and Kentucker Audley

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Leap Year (2010)
programme.desc: A woman plans to take advantage of an Irish tradition to propose to her boyfriend while on holiday in Dublin. When they become separated, she faces a disastrous journey across the country in the company of a charming local innkeeper, and is tempted to leave her boyfriend for her travelling companion. Romantic comedy, starring Amy Adams, Matthew Goode and Adam Scott

programme.title: Rat Race (2001)
programme.desc: A casino magnate approaches a group of no-hopers with the offer of $2million to whoever retrieves the sum from a locker in a train station in New Mexico, prompting a madcap cross-continent dash. Meanwhile, the casino owner's high-rolling gambler friends place bets on which of the bumbling contestants will win. Comedy, with Rowan Atkinson, John Cleese, Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Bates, Seth Green and Cuba Gooding Jr

programme.title: Earth vs the Flying Saucers (1956)
programme.desc: Aliens arrive on Earth with an ultimatum - surrender or face death - prompting humanity to pull out all the stops to find a way of defeating the extraterrestrial menace. Sci-fi drama, starring Hugh Marlowe, Joan Taylor, Donald Curtis and Morris Ankrum, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth (1954)
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush

programme.title: The Italian Job (1969)
programme.desc: A crook assembles a motley gang to steal 4million in gold bullion from an Italian armoured car, which brings Turin to a standstill and enables the robbers to make a quick getaway in a fleet of Minis - but they end up falling foul of the Mafia along the way. Crime comedy, starring Michael Caine, Noel Coward, Benny Hill, Tony Beckley and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service (2015)
programme.desc: A streetwise teenager is taken under the wing of his dead father's old colleague, an agent working for a super-secret spy organisation. Will the youngster turn out to be a chip off the old block by proving useful during a battle against a twisted, hi-tech genius? Action comedy based on a comic book, starring Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral (1994)
programme.desc: A London man's misfortunes in love look set to change when he meets an American beauty. However, the prospect of a transatlantic relationship succeeding seems slim, so the pair go their separate ways - only for him to realise he is unable to get her out of his mind. Richard Curtis's comedy, with Hugh Grant, Andie MacDowell, John Hannah, Charlotte Coleman, Kristin Scott Thomas, Simon Callow and James Fleet

programme.title: Rita, Sue and Bob Too (1987)
programme.desc: A bored married man decides the only way to get around his wife's indifferent attitude to sex is to have a fling with the teenage girls who babysit for them. However, it proves to be a risky manoeuvre, and his other half soon gets wind of the trio's liaisons through local gossip. Comedy, starring Siobhan Finneran, Michelle Holmes, George Costigan, Lesley Sharp and Willie Ross

programme.title: Tooth Fairy (2010)
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents' teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: Rango (2011)
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Carry On Constable (1960)
programme.desc: A flu epidemic leaves a police station short of staff, forcing a desperate inspector to send four bungling trainees on the beat. The inept would-be bobbies manage to increase the crime rate even before they have started work, and their long-suffering sergeant faces an uphill battle to whip them into shape. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims

programme.title: The Desert Rats (1953)
programme.desc: A Scottish army officer is placed in command of a unit of Australian troops given the task of defending Tobruk against overwhelming German forces, led by the renowned general Rommel. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Burton, Robert Newton and James Mason, reprising his role as Rommel from The Desert Fox

programme.title: The Mountain Between Us (2017)
programme.desc: An English neurosurgeon desperate to attend an operation crosses paths with an American bride-to-be determined to get to her wedding. When their chartered flight crashes, they attempt to survive in the wilderness, while fighting their attraction to each other. Romantic adventure, starring Idris Elba, Kate Winslet and Beau Bridges

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019)
programme.desc: Faded television actor Rick Dalton and his stunt double Cliff Booth strive to hang on to their careers during the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles. As they navigate a changing film industry they barely recognise any more, they are drawn into the orbit of both ill-fated rising star Sharon Tate, and Charles Manson and his cult of zealous followers. Drama from director Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie, Timothy Olyphant and Al Pacino

programme.title: The Death of Dick Long (2019)
programme.desc: Three friends gather for what is supposed to be a band practice, but when one of them is badly hurt while they are messing around, it falls to his gormless mates to help him - with disastrous results. Comedy directed by and starring Daniel Scheinert (co-helmer of Oscar-winner Everything Everywhere All at Once), with Michael Abbott Jnr and Andre Hyland

programme.title: Like a Boss (2020)
programme.desc: Friends Mia and Mel run their own beauty company. However, things take a turn for the worse when their business runs into a massive amount of debt. They are forced to turn to ruthless benefactor Claire Luna, head of a major cosmetics empire, who intends to steal the business from under them. Comedy, starring Tiffany Haddish, Rose Byrne and Salma Hayek

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Peri and Prince decide to team up to try and catch out Rayne. Meanwhile, Ste urges James to make things right with the McQueens

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Prince is accused of trying it on with Rayne at the party, and as Prince has no memory, he cannot defend himself. Elsewhere, Joel questions if Leela is taking on too much

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he earlier tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or fell by the wayside. First he visits the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, then heads to California to see the owners of Kingston Cafe, French-themed La Frite, and Capri

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The university tries to recruit another child prodigy, much to the displeasure of Sheldon, while Mary seeks June's advice when looking for a change

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The Coopers discuss the possibilities of black holes and alternate universes when Dr Sturgis comes over for dinner

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Detective Jake Peralta and his eclectic group of colleagues at Brooklyn's 99th Precinct are used to having a commanding officer who doesn't make them work too hard or follow the rules too closely. programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Essex couple Belinda and Alan have decided to take the leap and buy a property in or around the pretty seaside resort of La Cala de Mijas in Spain's Costa del Sol. They call upon the expertise of Laura Hamilton, who finds five options to show them within their 160,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Road Trip
programme.desc: A road trip around some of Europe's most beautiful locations, featuring Brits who have set up lives abroad. The first edition features southern Spain's whitewashed villages in Andaluca, where three sets of expats each run beautiful boutique hotels

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit Witney in Oxfordshire, where Henry comes across a tractor that has not run for quite a few years - but poses no problem for restorer Alan

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Tiverton in the West Country to meet petrolhead Roger. Henry finds part of a tornado jet that he wants to turn into a table, while Simon finds a pair of exhaust pipes, which he thinks could become a trendy pair of lamps

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers are asked to track down the relatives of a Lancashire farmer who died without leaving a will. Plus, the story of a search for heirs that involved two generations of women who had played invaluable roles on Britain's production lines

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives try to find the relatives of a deceased Sidcup woman after she left behind a property in south-east London, but no will. Plus, the hunt for a former political correspondent's family reveals the story of a talented man who enjoyed an illustrious career

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another quartet of B&B owners battle it out to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money, beginning with Paul Billington and Flora Loizou from Silverwood Lodge in Cambridgeshire. The couple get a frosty response when one guest learns her hosts do not live on-site, while another is left in hysterics by an unexpected discovery

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group sets off for Great Yarmouth to stay in Sue Dodd's dog-friendly Seashells Guesthouse. Spirits run high with a trip to the beach and a game of bingo, but Nancy's complaints over dog hairs on the sheets and smoking in the rooms bring down the light-hearted mood during dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: American ex-banker Nancy Hampson hosts at the Old Court Guesthouse in Bath, but her vocal criticisms of the week's first two establishments have made her no friends among her fellow competitors. Paul Billington is annoyed that the bed he and wife Flora Loizou are given is not big enough, but is more impressed when taken for food at a quirky local restaurant

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests stay with Caroline Scott, the owner of the Dean B&B near Longniddry, East Lothian The picturesque house and breathtaking views across the Firth of Forth win everyone over, but underwear in the drawers, cobwebs on the curtains and a messy breakfast service seriously hamper the host's chances of success

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Sue from Seashells in Great Yarmouth confronts Nancy Hampson about the controversial topic of smoking in bedrooms, while Paul Billington and Flora Loizou are held to account about their low mark for the Old Court Guesthouse

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Spider monkey Kiara becomes a mother for the first time, but keepers worry that the baby is becoming weak as Kiara appears to be more interested in playing with the other monkeys than taking on maternal responsibilities. Meanwhile, baby capybara Henry enjoys having the attention of all the female capybaras, and Babirusa Sausu moves from paddock to paddock to mate with various females

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: A saluki puppy called Harry has the cutest kangaroo jumps, but it remains to be seen whether he will prove the perfect pooch for Charlie and Ali. Nancy the Staffie plays a mean game of fetch - much to the Friend family's delight, while ex-breeding spaniel Tia seeks a new home to live out her retirement

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud visits a couple planning to build a home that looks like a work of art overlooking a valley in south Devon. Joe and Claire's new home will be a giant sculpture inspired by the local landscape, 70 metres long and featuring 34 enormous angled zinc shards jutting out in all directions. It will also be complicated to build and equally as expensive. And although Joe is wealthy, ambitious and fearless, his team quickly come up against problems and the budget virtually doubles the first walls go up. Is his dream home in danger of become a nightmare?

programme.title: Finding the Cornish Dream
programme.desc: Gillian has her heart set on a historical Falmouth house with sea views, while surfing estate agent James gets to grips with a former post office from the 1900s. As West Carclaze Garden Village prepares to open its doors with 1500 new homes, estate agent Andrew values an old mill with huge potential

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Cameras reveal what can go wrong when a dream holiday turns into a nightmare. Footage includes sunbed dashes, ski crashes, Brits behaving badly and locals behaving madly, all told by the people who were there. Psychologists and industry experts also reflect on the anxieties and situations that many can experience during a break

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man is brought in with stomach pains and a suspected abdominal aortic aneurysm. His son receives a huge blow when he is told his father only has a 50 per cent chance of surviving the operation he urgently needs. A 33-year-old is treated after swallowing a cocktail of drugs in a suicide attempt, and staff fight to save a teenager who was stabbed in a street fight and has lost a life-threatening amount of blood

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Heli-medics race to a skydiver who's suffered serious injuries after crashing into a house. There's a race across the country to reach a man who has fallen 40ft from a ladder. Plus, in Berkshire, biker Hanna is trapped with multiple injuries after hitting a road sign

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: In Coventry, crewmates Mark Rattray and Orlaigh Barbour attend a 73-year-old woman who is in agony after falling on the ice. Jan Vann and Chelsie Kennedy are sent to a baby who has been fitting. On the other side of the city, Neil Vann and Laura Perkins have to deal with a well-known drunk nuisance caller

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man is brought in with stomach pains and a suspected abdominal aortic aneurysm. His son receives a huge blow when he is told his father only has a 50 per cent chance of surviving the operation he urgently needs. A 33-year-old is treated after swallowing a cocktail of drugs in a suicide attempt, and staff fight to save a teenager who was stabbed in a street fight and has lost a life-threatening amount of blood

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty is in Thailand getting to grips with sticky rice. Kate Quilton works out how cream crackers could help with weight management, and Amanda Byram tests if cabbages could be a saviour for breastfeeding mothers

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Comedians Rufus Hound and Jenny Eclair are challenged to make Kimono-style garments against the clock

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: In southern Spain, Jonnie Irwin goes house-hunting in and around the hill-top town of Competa, Andalucia, with Michael and Seamus from Northern Ireland. The duo love cooking and entertaining and are searching for a holiday home where they can invite all their friends. However, while Seamus likes a modern style, Michael has much more traditional tastes, so with a budget of 175,000 and five options up his sleeve, Jonnie tries to come up with the perfect property to suit them both

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Road Trip
programme.desc: The European tour moves on to France's Bordeaux and Bergerac wine regions, where a pair of English winemakers are trying to make a name for themselves, and a sommelier and his chef wife are launching a gte and a cookery school. Narrated by Fred Sirieix

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Worcestershire to meet mechanic Adrian. Simon restores an old, wrecked armchair into some punk-rock furniture

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to Surrey to meet upcycler Rob, who has a range of sheds a few miles from Gatwick Airport

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team looks for relatives of a woman who was part of the famous Second World War code-breaking mission at Bletchley Park in Buckinghamshire - and believe she may have had a sister. Another case uncovers the rousing story of a labour activist who fought for the rights of people in her beloved south Wales mining community, and there is a round-up of details relating to unclaimed estates

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives find themselves under pressure to trace the relatives of a former RAF officer, but the task proves difficult because he has a common surname. Plus, the story of a man who, having already lost two brothers in the First World War, suffered further tragedy while protecting his family decades later during the Blitz

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Beverly Green welcome their guests to Centery Farm, Devon, where one contestant decides to keep her past as a hotel inspector secret. The couple's afternoon herding activity is thwarted by heavy rain and fog, and the following morning's feedback showdown has repercussions that will be felt all week

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Professional chef Ben Cooke invites the contestants to the Little Gloster on the Isle of Wight, where he hopes to impress them with a taste of Scandinavian living. Assisted by his 81-year-old grandmother Lillian, who has more than 50 years' experience in the hotel industry, the host splits the visitors into two teams for a contest, but simmering tensions quickly reach boiling-point, resulting in a bitter snub at dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Stephen Hammon hosts the third day of the competition at the four-star Old Hall House B&B in Warwickshire, providing his guests with a variety of on-site activities including shooting and archery before taking them for a meal at his own restaurant. However, he ends up trying too hard to impress at breakfast the next day after Sandie De Rougemont reveals her past as a hotel inspector

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ex-hotel inspector Sandie De Rougemont, owner of the House of Agnes in Canterbury, plays host. She takes her guests to a local brewery and an upmarket restaurant, where everyone seems to enjoy themselves, but the revelation that a ghost may roam the rooms of the B&B leaves some of the participants nervous

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, keepers prepare for the difficult task of transporting giraffe Kidepo to a new zoo, and Kidepo's brother Narus is not making the move any easier. Meanwhile, silvery gibbon Alvin is keen to get close to his partner Tilu again, and after diving headfirst into an empty pool one too many times, keepers decide a trip to the vet is in order for caiman lizard Gary to see if there is an underlying problem. Elsewhere, dominant warthog Magnum is being challenged by fellow warthog Dobby, so keepers decide it is time to move Dobby to a zoo in Germany

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: It's double trouble as bonded pair Poppy and Bron try to find a home that will accept two dogs. Fine artist Ron is introduced to Chip the terrier cross and Margaux the mongrel, while Harry the saluki needs to overcome his nerves if he is to find loving new owners

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Andy Stakes and Jeanette Hardy, who are building a new house on top of a sheer cliff on the west coast of Scotland. The pair want to spend 250,000 on a two-bedroom, glass-fronted and earth-sheltered home for themselves and their two beloved Newfoundland dogs. However, construction on such an exposed site is fraught with danger and the pair face no end of problems throughout the build, and a last minute design change that begs the biggest question: even if Andy finishes the house, will Jeanette actually like it?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Twenty year-old Peta is rushed into Queen's Medical Centre after coming off her motorbike, her mum explains the struggle she went through raising a child with both Asperger's and ADHD. After a previous stabbing 21 year-old Callum was left with a stoma, he arrives at the hospital after it has badly prolapsed. Forty-four year-old Libby comes in after being hit in the face with a hockey stick, she tells the story of how her professional footballer husband taking on a new career path changed her life

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: An air ambulance is dispatched to the island of Mull, where 23-year-old rally driver Scott has rolled his car down a 20-foot embankment. In Glasgow city centre, the trauma team fight to save the life of a man who was hit by a bus and dragged under the wheels, while the coast guard helicopter flies to a remote sea loch to rescue a woman who has fallen 15 feet down a waterfall

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man with schizophrenia is admitted for the 19th time in a year after failing to take his diabetes medication. Meanwhile, a former betting-shop manager and a 16-year-old both suffer suspected strokes - the 61-year-old, once known as the 'memory man', is now coming to terms with his diminishing mental capabilities, while the teenager's identical twin and mother wait by his bedside for the results of a brain scan

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A visitor to the Appleby horse fair in Cumbria needs emergency intervention after a cardiac arrest, a 12-year-old girl is treated for multiple injuries after a collision with a vehicle, while in Co Durham, a man is found confused and injured after a fall while walking in the countryside

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Crewmates Rob Moore and Ally Shipway rush to a dramatic car crash. The driver of the car is arrested for drink-driving. Jan Vann and Chelsie Kennedy treat a 93-year-old war veteran who has fallen and may also have a life-threatening infection. Paramedics Peter Bowles and Manoj Summan treat a man who may have had a stroke. They also rush to a four-year-old who is pale and vomiting and needs to be seen by specialists right away

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Twenty year-old Peta is rushed into Queen's Medical Centre after coming off her motorbike, her mum explains the struggle she went through raising a child with both Asperger's and ADHD. After a previous stabbing 21 year-old Callum was left with a stoma, he arrives at the hospital after it has badly prolapsed. Forty-four year-old Libby comes in after being hit in the face with a hockey stick, she tells the story of how her professional footballer husband taking on a new career path changed her life

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty finds out why pasta comes in so many different shapes, Kate Quilton is hot on the trail of the spice ratings in ready meals, and how they are determined, and Briony May Williams looks at the butter content in buttermilk

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits Manhattan, where she creates candy canes and lollipops at artisan sugar crafter Papabubble, before heading back to the UK to learn how to make passion fruit marshmallows covered in chocolate and coconut

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman goes house hunting with Mandy and Paul from Sussex around the picturesque Spanish town of Dolores. They're dreaming of a permanent move to their favourite part of the Costa Blanca with their six cats and rescue dog and would love to find a house with plenty of outside space for their furry family. Jasmine manages to find five properties within their maximum budget of 185,000, but whether any of them will be liked by her clients remains to be seen

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Road Trip
programme.desc: A trip around the coast of Majorca in a sailing boat, and the family who are attempting to launch a restaurant on the north of the island. Narrated by Fred Sirieix

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Wokingham in Berkshire to meet professional gardener Mark whose barns are brimful of bikes, bric-a-brac and baggage

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in Windsor, Berkshire, to meet Roy, whose garages are stacked full of bikes. Henry picks the one that doesn't work to take away, while Simon converts some 17th-century wooden beams into a pair of stylish bedside lamps

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers look for beneficiaries to the 750,000 estate of an Oxfordshire man who died in 2011, and try to find out if a Salford man who they have been tracing relatives for owned his own property. Plus, details of unclaimed estates with heirs still waiting to be found

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives visit a stately home in Warwickshire as they try to find relatives of a lady who was born there, and an heir on another case embarks on a journey of discovery to learn about the grandfather he never met. Plus, details of unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: A quartet of B&B owners battle it out to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money, beginning with luxury weight-loss and detox retreat Slimmeria in East Sussex. The guests worry about uncomfortable sleeping arrangements, the price of accommodation and the strict 9pm curfew - and the prospect of a dance-style workout only exacerbates their bad mood

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jan and William Cheeseman, owners of five-star Gold-rated 38 St Giles in Norwich, try to impress their competitors. Unfortunately, poor breakfast presentation and complaints about noise from the street increase the tension between the couple as they strive for perfection

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ann and Bill Clay play host at their four-star Bosvean House B&B in Bude, Cornwall. Diane and Max Seivewright query the establishment's luxury description, while Galia Grainger complains about the lack of a sea view. However, the hosts hope an indulgent Cornish cream tea, a stick dance and a drink in their garden shed will succeed in winning over the guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Village bakers Diane and Max Seivewright, the owners of Ombersley B&B in Worcestershire, host the last round of the competition, but some guests are far from impressed with the rooms and food

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners gather to find out who has won the competition. Diane and Max Seivewright, the hosts at Ombersley B&B, feel betrayed by Ann and Bill Clay's feedback and want to know why they have been so harshly criticised, while Galia Grainger asks why Slimmeria's rules and regulations have provoked so much hostility

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the secret life of the animals of Chester Zoo, one of Britain's most popular zoos, using new micro-rig technology to capture the behaviour of the animals and their close relationships with their keepers. Vets at Chester Zoo treat an elephant calf for the herpes virus, the same virus that resulted in the deaths of two calves the year before. A breeding phenomenon plays out among the extraordinary cardinal fish, and the zoo's humboldt penguins welcome 16 new members to their colony

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Sammy the retriever is acting mopey as yet another of his buddies finds a new home. However, when Max appears, it might just be that he has found his new best friend. Margot the collie needs an owner who will ensure that her active mind stays busy, while hiker Katherine wants a dog that can keep up with her. It may just be that they are the perfect match - so long as Margot's nerves don't get the better of her. After 200 days at Woodgreen, Brooke the German shepherd is still struggling to find a home. Is there a happy ending around the corner?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Cumbrian couple Rob and Ruth, who have bought a 200-year-old former blacking mill and plan to slot in an entirely new, timber-clad structure within its walls, giving the impression that it is peeping out from the original ruins. But the original building is a scheduled monument and Historic England inform them it is too dangerous to repair, giving them no choice but to painstakingly rebuild the ancient mill around their new structure

programme.title: Secret History
programme.desc: Cameras follow the multimillion-dollar expedition that discovered the Victorian ship HMS Erebus, intact and upright on the Arctic sea floor in September 2014. The story unfolds in the freezing Arctic, where search vessels battled with heavy sea-ice that threatened to stop the search entirely, to the dramatic chain of events that led to the historic discovery

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The latest batch of patients to be treated in the A&E department of London's King's College Hospital includes two with serious head injuries, including a cyclist from Brighton who has been airlifted to the building. Also brought in by helicopter is a father-of-four who fell from scaffolding as he repaired a roof, while other cases include former docker Bill, who has hurt his knee while drinking at his local working men's club

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The stories of children and teenagers brought into A&E. Sixteen-year-old Ellie has suspected spinal injuries after being thrown from her horse and crushed against a fence, while consultant Jacqui Butler treats four-year-old Destiny, who has a fishbone stuck in his tonsils from his lunchtime curry. Plus, a pregnant woman experiences intense pain following a sudden haemorrhage

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Oxfordshire, cyclist Matt suffers life-threatening injuries after a collision with a car. On the A1, 64-year-old John is trapped in his car after a head-on collision. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, heli-medics fly to one of the most remote roads in Britain to help Caroline who has come off a motorbike and is injured

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Major trauma cases dealt with by West Midlands Ambulance Service paramedics, including a woman who has just given birth to a baby who is not breathing, and a bike ride in a park that has ended with an open fracture of the ankle

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt visits Argentina to learn the secret of perfect popcorn, Andi Oliver looks at how the mould gets put inside blue cheese, and Jimmy Doherty is in Germany to see how electricity is used in cutting-edge crisp production

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: This time, Yianni is challenged to customise the ex-Man City and Arsenal defender Bacary Sagna's sportscar, and has plenty of ideas for an unusual design

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Yianni transforms a stunning yellow Ferrari 488 into the perfectly wrapped race car, but the team discovers that working on a one-off 488 for the track poses unique challenges

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test-drive an Aston Martin DBS Convertible, a Ferrari California and a Lamborghini Gallardo Convertible through Romania, searching for the mountain highway built during the reign of the country's former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu - allegedly the best road to drive on in the world. Actor Eric Bana is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.desc: Packages of meth are found in the wall of a trailer. Two brothers are caught smuggling pills. Prohibited Mexican delicacies are intercepted

programme.desc: The sugar train is desperate to hit its deadline for the first cane harvest of the year. Plus, the Gemco team tackle a problematic N-Class locomotive to get it back in service

programme.desc: Johnny Vegas, Nancy Dell'Olio, Tim Vine and Chris Kamara fight for the lots at auction

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond take on a challenge to find an alternative to the expensive diesel-fuelled hatchbacks driven by British police officers. Alan Carr and Justin Lee Collins take up the gauntlet as the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Schitt's Creek

programme.title: QI XL

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Montreal, Michael Portillo discovers how French and British colonial roots have influenced the city's construction, cuisine and culture. Undaunted by his guidebook's description of the treacherous Lachine Rapids, the one-time MP gets a thorough soaking on a white-knuckle boat ride down the St. Lawrence River. In the Canadian capital, Ottawa, Michael visits the country's parliament to hear about the birth of the new nation after Confederation in 1867. And at Ottawa's historic Central Experimental Farm, Michael hears of the pioneering discoveries, which launched a Canadian wheat boom

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade returns with the offbeat tourism show and is joined in the first edition by comedy actress and writer Dawn French, with the pair spending two days in the Greek capital. Their mini-break features doughnuts, the Acropolis and the thermal waters of Lake Vouliagmeni, which is rumoured to be the goddess Athena's favourite bathing spot. Richard and Dawn sample a 14-course tasting menu at a temple to molecular gastronomy, before they go on an Olympic tour featuring discus and javelin training

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedian Nish Kumar for a short break in Portugal's second city, starting their trip with a welcome tipple of its eponymous fortified wine. To get their bearings, they hire electric scooters and refuel with Porto's favourite sandwich, the meaty francesinha, before having a 5D cinema experience and climbing the Arrabida bridge. Nish makes a confession at a church, and then the duo indulge in a selection of local pastries with a cake connoisseur, and test out artisanal soap

programme.desc: Richard Ayoade returns with the offbeat tourism show. In the first edition, he is joined by Stephen Merchant to enjoy a weekend break in the Croatian city of Dubrovnik. A Game of Thrones tour features some of the show's most celebrated locations, while Richard and Stephen also visit a hilltop fort still littered with landmines dating from the war of the 1990s

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedian Joe Wilkinson for a two-day break in Poland's second city Krakow, beginning by attending a baking workshop, before heading to a salt mine to marvel at the world's largest underground chapel. They also drive to Nowa Huta, a showcase suburb of socialist realism, where they end up in an authentic communist-era apartment - with obligatory vodka and pickles. After a lunch of pierogi dumplings, they take part in a stained glass workshop at the centre of Krakow's art nouveau movement

programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comedian Ellie Taylor head to the Spanish capital for a two-day break, following an itinerary rich in art, history, histrionics and ham. The pair go on a guided tour in which they view masterpieces by Bosch, Velasquez, Picasso and Dali, before they attend a ham-carving workshop and a sample a five-course tasting menu, of which four courses are pork or ham, including a tartare dish. They also take in a lively boating lake, a circus church and a grisly tour of the Spanish Inquisition

Amelie makes a trip to Shropshire to make her own encaustic tiles in one of the last remaining factories in the country to use traditional methods. Plus, George revisits Michele in Warwickshire to see how she is getting on remodelling her adjoining Grade II listed cottages

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In 2003, Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp were tasked with finding homes that would bring two pairs of lovebirds together. A frustrating 10-mile gap was keeping Annmarie and Robert apart, while 300 miles separated Alison and Martin. Twelve years later, the hosts find out whether either or both couples remain together in the United Kingdom

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Lysette and Nigel Offley, who are knocking down an old Thames boathouse and constructing a cutting-edge home in its place. Taking inspiration from the river itself, they have designed a building of waves and curves with a huge glass porthole for a roof light. But problems begin almost from the start, as they cannot find a contractor willing to build over the water, their architect leaves unexpectedly and the costs turn out much higher than expected. To make matters worse, the neighbours are not happy about such a radical sight in their traditional community. As they begin to compromise, Kevin wonders if the couple's dreams will ever be realised

However, as Heather's mum is in a home in Hampshire, they would also like a smaller base near to her for when they visit the UK. Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin help them find the best of both

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Triathletes Ron and Mel plan to sell their family home and buy two new properties with the proceeds. The pair look for a small house in the area of Kent where they already live and a ski chalet in the Les Gets area of France, where they want to enjoy winter and summer sports with friends and family

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon Garner and her son Shaun help cleaning company owners Kevin and Kate Waring from Coventry find a villa in Almeria, while Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez help Karen and Steve Cummins find their ideal holiday home in Alicante

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Simran Samra hosts the first party in east London, and decides to cook meat for her main course, despite being a vegetarian. The fashionista tries to salvage her chances of winning the 1,000 prize by performing a range of comedy accents after fellow competitor Alan Price upsets one of the guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedian Yoshki Greenberg hosts the second dinner party in east London, but her decision to surprise the guests by asking them to wear animal-themed pyjama suits does not go down well - leaving her struggling to win them over with a stand-up routine

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alan Price hosts the third party in east London, and sets out to impress his fellow competitors with a medieval-themed dinner. He hopes to raise the standard of the contest with an ambitious menu, but stumbles at the first hurdle when vegetarian diner Simran Samra panics at the sight of his authentic pig's head as the table centrepiece. Things do not improve as the night goes on, with dirty dinner plates and sloppy hosting leaving the guests less than impressed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bar owner Delia Elliot hosts the fourth dinner party from east London, and she is confident she can teach her young diners the protocol of entertaining guests. However, prankster Alan Price ends up having an argument with her, leading Simran Samra to take evasive action

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Doctor Chintu Gademsetty hosts the final dinner party in east London, and is confident of impressing his guests with a 1980s-themed evening. Even though his dance competition is not a hit with all of the diners, his food goes down a treat, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Craig Rowe helps photographer and videographer Geoff find a holiday home in Barbados on a budget of 160,000

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Lysette and Nigel Offley, who are knocking down an old Thames boathouse and constructing a cutting-edge home in its place. Taking inspiration from the river itself, they have designed a building of waves and curves with a huge glass porthole for a roof light. But problems begin almost from the start, as they cannot find a contractor willing to build over the water, their architect leaves unexpectedly and the costs turn out much higher than expected. To make matters worse, the neighbours are not happy about such a radical sight in their traditional community. As they begin to compromise, Kevin wonders if the couple's dreams will ever be realised

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George heads to Kent to help Pete and Amelie make their huge 16 room Victorian house fit for modern life, with plans to make a playroom and a library. Amelie makes a trip to Shropshire to make her own encaustic tiles in one of the last remaining factories in the country to use traditional methods. Plus, George revisits Michele in Warwickshire to see how she is getting on remodelling her adjoining Grade II listed cottages

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A five-year-old Bedlington terrier, who has suffered a broken front leg three times in the last four years, is referred to Noel with another fracture in her leg. Elsewhere, beloved fox red Labrador Jethro has arthritic elbows, which have left him unable to walk properly and are causing him great pain. Noel uses a tiny camera to take a closer look at the joint damage and determine the best course of action

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Retrospective edition recalling series highlights from 2022. The line-up of famous faces includes Rylan, Gyles Brandreth, Joanna Lumley, Tom Allen, Rob Beckett, Mo Gilligan, Babatunde Aleshe, Denise Van Outen, Duncan James, Sophie Ellis-Bextor, Zoe Ball, Shaun Ryder and Bez. They comment on shows including Love Island, Platinum Party at the Palace, The Savoy, Spooked Scotland, Saturday Night Fever, Big Boys and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire: Soccer Aid Special

programme.title: Confessions of a Cam Girl
programme.desc: Part one of two. The stories of five women selling explicit videos online. The market has exploded since lockdown, leaving them struggling to find a niche among their competitors. Maya uses her earnings to support her family financially, but is feeling burned out by the pressure to produce as much content as possible, while Sarah has been invited to attend her first-ever photoshoot in Marbella

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: The unit hunt for a group of kids trying to set fire to a shed in an allotment. Plus, the night-time search for a burglar breaking into a house with a suspected cannabis crop

Wonder, a blind dog, exhibits extreme anxiety whenever he finds himself in unfamiliar places. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Events boss Sharon hosts the final night in Manchester. With her hearty decadent menu on offer, she has to win over Cleona after a bust up on from Cleona's turn as host. Sharon's skills and decorum are put to the test, though Mozz, Matt and James are on hand for moral support

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
